results.description:
LIVE STREAM FROM SILICON VALLEY.  

PLEASE RSVP ON THIS MEETUP SITE AND YOU WILL BE SENT INSTRUCTIONS TO GET THE LINK.

----------------------------------------------------

Access Silicon Valley and Women's Startup Lab invite you to join us on May 24, 2016, for an INCREDIBLY special evening with STEVE GOLDBERG, an operating partner at Venrock, one of the Valley’s most sought after, early stage firms! Some of Venrock's early stage investments include: Apple, Intel, Illumina, AppNexus, Dollar Shave Club, AthenaHealth, Klout, Gilead, Acceleron, Cloudflare.

In this Fireside Chat--Unleashed event (we call it "unleashed" because it is interactive, audience driven), Steve will discuss topics of burning interest to startup entrepreneurs and investors. Join us for this one-night only event of uniquely combined insights from both the VC and entrepreneur perspectives!

Don't miss STEVE GOLDBERG unleashed!!  

AGENDA

 7:00pm - 8:30pm PST: Discussion with Steve


ABOUT STEVE

Steve is a prominent VC in Iot, robotics, wireless and signal processing companies and has significant experience as VC, founder and entrepreneur, with profound insights to share.

Prior to Venrock, Steve co-founded DataRunway, Inc., a broadband wireless communications company and was CEO of several early stage companies including Vidient, Arcwave and CoWave Networks. During his tenure at Arcwave the company raised over $28M from a number of first tier venture capital firms including Mayfield, Venrock, SBV, Lucent, Comcast Interactive Capital and Vulcan Capital.

He currently serves in the Board of Directors of several companies: Red Seal, SV Forum, Future Dial and Quantenna Communications.

 ABOUT VENROCK

Originally established as the venture capital arm of the Rockefeller family in 1969, Venrock partners with entrepreneurs to build some of the world’s most disruptive, successful companies. 

Venrock led Apple's first venture round and held a board seat for nearly 20 years. Also, in its first year Venrock invested in Intel, one of the most successful chip companies in the world.

SELECT INVESTMENTS:

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LOOKING FOR A SPONSOR: We are looking for a sponsor for the livestream, and if anyone is interested, please shoot me a message. The stream is broadcast to startup entrepreneurs (Access Silicon Valley members) in San Diego, Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York, Boston, Chicago, Seattle, Austin, Houston, Dallas, Miami, Gainesville, Boulder/Denver, Tel Aviv, Toronto and Mexico City, and the sponsor will have their logo prominently displayed on the video during the entire event (and on the video wherever it may be posted) and a shout out at the event before it starts.


EVENT ORGANIZERS:



PREMIER SPONSORS:

Procopio- Ranked among the 2014 Best Law Firms by U.S. News & World Report

results.description:
An evening of meditation practice, led by Rev. Kim K. Crawford Harvie, Senior Minister. Sessions include seated & walking meditation, Dharma talk, and conversation. This practice is open to all, beginning and experience practitioners.

The warm, inviting evening includes two short seated meditations; walking meditation through the gorgeous Arlington Street Church sanctuary and Public Garden; and community discussion.

Rev. Kim K. Crawford Harvie is an extraordinary and inspired leader in the LGBTQ community. She is founder of The Shared Heart, a traveling exhibition and book of photographs of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender teenagers, designed to support the Massachusetts Safe Schools Initiative. The Legacy Foundation named Rev. Crawford Harvie Uncommon Woman of the Year. The Women's Educational and Industrial Union of Boston honored her as one of 100 outstanding women in the Commonwealth. She is recipient of the Maximilian Kolbe Award for Community Service and was named Provincetown Citizen of the Year. In 2004, she performed the first same-sex wedding in a church in the United States.

Rev. Kim has been a Zen Buddhist practitioner since 1977.

For more information on the evening: Arlington Street Zen Center

Prior to the ASZC at 7:00 pm, you are also warmly invited to join the Buddha's Belly Book Group at 6:00 pm in the Hunnewell Chapel. Check out the ASC website for information on what book the Buddhas Belly group is currently reading.

Greg Bedard has been a Senior NFL writer for Sports Illustrated since May 2013. He was previously the lead NFL columnist at the Boston Globe since 2010. Bedard previously produced award-winning work covering the Green Bay Packers for the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel and the Miami Dolphins for the Palm Beach Post. Bedard, who began covering the NFL in 1999 and has worked nine Super Bowls, and has been honored by the Associated Press Sports Editors, Pro Football Writers Association, Editor & Publisher and the Society of Professional Journalists. Bedard, a graduate of Lincoln-Sudbury, has a journalism degree from Rutgers University. He lives in the area with his wife and twin son and daughter.

results.description:
Join Vilna Shul for a the premier East Coast screening of the critically acclaimed film Munich '72 and Beyond. On September 5, 1972, Palestinian extremists infiltrated the athletes’ dorms at the Munich Summer Olympics to take 11 Israeli athletes hostage and eventually murdered them all before being killed or captured by the German police. Award-winning filmmaker Stephen Crisman revisits that tragic day in chilling detail through new interviews with both Israelis and Palestinians, as well as family members, eyewitnesses, Olympic authorities and government officials. An intensely emotional account of the first act of modern terrorism viewed worldwide as it unfolded, Munich ’72 and Beyond exposes shocking new information about the tragic events and their devastating aftermath, as well as chronicling the four-decade-long struggle to create a public memorial to the victims of the massacre.

The film screening will be 45-minutes, followed by a Q&A with the Director. Free and open to the public.
Register at http://www.vilnashul.org/events/event/film_screening_munich_and_beyond. The Vilna Shul is the last immigrant era synagogue building that exists in downtown Boston. Located in historic Beacon Hill, the Vilna currently operates as a cultural center celebrating Jewish culture and its intersection with other cultures.

The closest T subway stop is Charles/MGH. Validated parking for $5 per car is available nearby and ONLY for the underground parking at the Charles River Plaza/Cambridge Street Garage at 165 Cambridge Street nearby. Please be advised that drivers must validate their green parking ticket at the Vilna Shul for validated parking. This is not the above-ground Whole Foods lot. For detailed directions to the Vilna, please click the following link to our Hours, Directions, and Parking page of our website. If you have any questions, email [masked] or call (617) 523-2324.
results.name: Film Screening Munich ‘72 and Beyond with Director Q&A

Cultivating Healthy Relationships                                                                                                     a meditation class series 

TUESDAYS | May 10th - June 14th


7:00 - 8:30pm

Relationships are a work in progress, so just imagine if all your relationships were free from conflict and deeply satisfying. Finding the right mental attitude is the key to making this happen. Without a fundamental shift in our views, we will continue to be stuck in our well-worn relationship patterns.

In this drop-in class series, we will learn how to distinguish between what love is – and what it isn’t. We will see how letting go of the mind of attachment can transform our bad relationships into good ones. And how it can make our good relationships even better! 

Each class is beginner friendly- feel free to drop-in to any class in the series or try to attend each one! No need to pre-register. 

with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher, Kyle Davis

• This is a spiritual meet-up for those interested in Reiki shares and enhancing their practitioners skills. This is also a group for healing others in the community and long distance. 

We welcome those in our community who need and believe in hands-on spiritual healing ONLY at the beginning of each share and as recipients only. 

Each share begins with a Reiki meditation. This is followed by group/community healing - upon request. THOSE WHO ARE FROM THE COMMUNITY AND ARE NOT REIKI PRACTITIONERS and are joining us ONLY because they are suffering from an ailment will be on the tables FIRST for a 30 min group treatment and prayers. After treatment, community members can rest as we will be break for refreshments and then will need to quietly leave the space to practitioners only. Please see note below+++ 

Following that, practitioners will break into groups of 2-4 per table for practitioner's only share. The schedule for this meet-up is as follows: 

• 6:45 pm Welcome and table setup 

• 7 pm - 7:30 pm Reiki Meditation, community healing upon request. This guided meditation followed by hands-on healing will be especially geared towards addictions. There will be a discussion on the power of Reiki in overcoming addictions. Anyone who suffers from a particular addiction, or any ailment - who is not Reiki attuned - and is willing to take the first step towards overcoming it, is free to come to the first hour of this meet-up.

• 7:30 pm - 8 pm Light refreshments break, intros, goodbyes to community patients (if any) 

• 8:00 pm - 10:00 pm Reiki shares for practitioners only. (Must be attuned through a real RMT not a DVD to participate) 

The short exercises we will be offering for practitioners are different in every meet-up. These methods were used in Japan and the purpose is to enhance your intuition as a healer.

Community members who are NOT Reiki practitioners:

 +++Please be advised that we do NOT guarantee or claim to provide any healing or improvement or treatment to your condition. Reiki is a spiritual energy-based practice that may or may not help to provide relief from pain, trauma,  post-cancer treatment, emotional issues, help with addictions and overall wellness. Those seeking relief from the community must email me first before coming in with a real picture on their profile, confirmation they are coming in on time (7 pm), You only need to bring your intent to heal. No need to share your information. You will need to sign a waiver due to the laws of this country. We promise to treat you with respect and dignity in a safe environment where love is abundant.

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
Hello and welcome to another edition of the Manga Club! I hope you are ready to read and enjoy another manga club title together. Or, at the very least, rip it apart in a constructive fashion :)

However, I would like to take a moment to get serious. Over the last few months, attendance has been down more and more dramatically. This is not something I want to continue.

This club has been going for over three years, and there have been a lot of good times. That being said, I think that I need to build it back up again.

To that end, I am going to ask for some honest input. It might be any number of issues, be it the titles read, the day of the week, or the format of the meetings. I want to work on saving this event, and hope you are willing to help me. Therefore, I am setting up a number of questions for registration. Please answer them honestly so that I can improve things for you, the membership.

In addition, for those of you who would like to respond, but are not interested in this month’s title, feel free to comment in the space below or direct message me.

What is your favorite genre of manga? What is one title from that genre that you have absolutely loved?

Thank you, and I hope this only improves future manga club experiences. Now that we have the serious stuff out of the way, let us move on to this month’s title!

Biomega Vol 1 and 2 by Tsutomu Nihei

Zoichi Kanoe plunges into the depths of 9JO-an island city in the middle of the Pacific Ocean-in search of Eon Green, a girl with the power to transmute the N5S virus. He's not the only one looking for her, though… Agents of the Public Health Service's Compulsory Execution Unit are also in hot pursuit. Zoichi and his transhuman allies have no time to waste; the countdown to the zombie apocalypse has begun!!


As per normal, a limited number of copies of the volumes are available at our venue. Make sure to call ahead and reserve yours today!
Hope to see you soon!
results.name: May Manga Club! Apocalypse Now!

We are meeting every Tuesday night from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM practicing Modern Arnis, WC, and SCJ flow drills and Self-Defense skills.

All levels are welcome!  For ages 15 and up.


The price is $15.00 /per person /per meetup. The first meetup is free.

Please wear loose fitting, comfortable cloths suitable for working out.

Please do not wear shoes that you've worn outdoors on the wood floor.



Instructor's Background

Alix Lavaud has been training Martial Arts for over 45 years and is a master of Modern Arnis, Pien San Wing Chun Kung Fu, and has extensive training in Small Circle Jujitsu.  He also humbly owns the rank of Lakan Apat (a 4th degree BLACKBELT ).


Lineage

Modern Arnis :  Remy Presas  -->  Alix Lavaud

Wing Chun:  Henry Mui  -->  Alix Lavaud

Small Circle Jujitsu:  Wally Jay -->  Alix Lavaud


Philosophy

 Go With The Flow ...

Some Quotes we Love

“If your mind is empty, it is ready for anything. In the beginner’s mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert’s there are few”
― Shunryu Suzuki


“Everything is perfect and there is always room for improvement.”
― Shunryu Suzuki

“We must exist right here and right now!”
― Shunryu Suzuki

Benefits of Martial Arts

1.  Mental Benefits

2.  Improved Balance

3.  Improved Flexibility

4.  Focus and stillness

5.  Hand and Eye Coordination

6.  Improved reflexes

7.  Learn self-defense skills

8.  Stress relief

9.  Relax

10.  Gain Self Confident and Self Respect

11.  Learn to Breathe

12.  Learn to Find Focus and Stillness

13.  Encouraging Non-Violent Conflict Resolution

14.  Improvement in many other Areas of Life

results.description:
This monthly series highlights the best vocal music in jazz, blues, pop and more, backed by a great trio, including Mark Shilansky on piano, Steve Chagarris drums, and Greg Holt,bass. May's concert features Celia Slattery and guest artist Pyeng Threadgill from New York.


The daughter of noted Jazz composer and recent Pulitzer prize winner Henry Threadgill and a dancer/choreographer mother, Pyeng Threadgill has been composing music since age 4. By 2004 Threadgill landed her first record deal with the album “Sweet Home: The Music of Robert Johnson” quickly followed by “Of The Air” (Random Chance Records). Both records soon propelled her onto a European tour and by 2008 Pyeng had developed the song cycle for her third release “Portholes To a Love & Other Short Stories,” which earned her a Fellowship in music composition through New York Foundation For The Arts. Her latest project explores the inner and outer contradictions of African American ancestry, adornment and hair.

Celia Slattery's original music weaves elements of jazz, pop and folk/rock with perceptive lyrics inspired by artists like Joni Mitchell and Leonard Cohen. She also covers everyone from Ella to Adele, giving context to the music through humor and stories. Celia released her third CD last year, Our Life Together, a “wonderfully crafted album that’s highlighted by soul-stirring performances both musically and vocally.” (Metronome Magazine)

Mark Shilansky is a multi-talented instrumentalist, singer, songwriter, arranger and producer. Jon Garelick of the Boston Globe called his most recent release, Fugue Mill, “an especially fresh and inventive jazz album.” Mark is in demand as an accompanist for singers including grammy award-winning Luciana Souza, Rebecca Parris, and Kim Nazarian (New York Voices). Celia and Mark have been friends and collaborators for almost twenty years, and Mark produced and played on two of Celia’s CDs.

Singers are invited to bring their music and sit in with the band!
results.name: Celia Slattery and Singers Showcase at Ryles

results.description: Bring your little ones to our AWESOME facility to have a blast with friends! Pack a snack and spend an hour. Exxcel is jam-packed with exciting toys, props, games, and activities for your little ones to enjoy in this non-structured “open play”. You and your child will participate in innovative, fun-filled obstacle courses that teach the basic gymnastics elements - swinging, climbing, running, jumping, and other motor development activities. Parents work with their children on basic motor development in this movement class that emphasizes exploration. Trampolines and our giant foam pit enhance your toddler's coordination and enjoyment. You and your child will have a ball spending quality time together at gymnastics class!! This playdate will be 1 hr long. Feel free to have a snack after in one of our party rooms as long as you clean up! $10/child $15/family. $8/child currently enrolled in a class at Exxcel $12/family currently enrolled in a class at Exxcel Spaces are limited RSVP soon! Ages: Crawling-5 years are welcome!

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Payment in advance is preferred, but you can pay when you arrive if necessary. Go here to pay in advance and don't forget to RSVP here on meetup too.

Come, enjoy and learn many permaculture techniques, plant id, plant care, harvesting and processing practices while socializing with other like-minded gardeners. Work with permaculture gardeners Debby and Lillabeth and go home with new knowledge and samples from the garden.

About iFarm: ifarm utilizes a restored 19th century farmstead to reconnect the individual with the earth. The goal is to provide diverse educational experiences that utilize core values of sustainability, rejuvenation, and thoughtful design which both individuals and communities can incorporate into their own environment, experiences and life.

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill 
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street 
Mission Hill, Roxbury 
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops) 
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer, 
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2). 

Some arrive as early as 3:30 pm (you don't NEED to do that, but you're welcome to do so; OUR meetup's attendees - it's posted on 6 meetups - are often there early, and you can chat).


We (MOST of us) arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm or so (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Use the T - #66 bus comes by - E-Line or Orange Line

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort.
TALK with us FIRST !!
Looking for Gifted Marketers to
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag?

Portion Control

Bake...Don't Fry!

Roasted Veggie Stackers

No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream

Avocados!!!

Salad with Chipotle Hummus

Simple Cilantro Chutney

More $2 bags of Produce!

Drink your greens!
results.name: VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill - Take home 1-2 bags free

Please arrive 15-30 min before tee off time, pay greens fee, sign in and be prepared to tee off at 5:15.

Pine Oaks Golf Course in Easton, MA, has offered us 3 tee times at starting at 5:15pm on Wednesdays, through August 31.

I will post this weekly during the season and accept 12 players (ASGA members  are priority) plus a waitlist. The 9-hole fee is $18.  This is a very walkable course, but carts are available for $15.   If for any reason you need to cancel, please do so 24 hours ahead of time and change your RSVP.  This allows those on the waitlist time to fill your spot.

This event is open to official ASGA members initially, then to MeetUp members.   In fairness to our official ASGA members who have paid the $79 membership fee for the year, any meetup members or non-ASGA member will incur a $5 surcharge each week they play with us (except the first time).  To avoid the weekly surcharge, please go to www.singlesgolf.com and click 'join' to become a member.

Please review the Boston Chapter of ASGA Code of Conduct and Policy Statement located on this site under "Pages."

Doyle's Bar & Grill  ( Rte 138 in Easton ) is our "10th hole”.

If you have any questions, please email me by clicking on my profile and clicking on 'message.' This is a private email.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!  Let's play golf and have fun!

results.description:
Part of the Seven Lectures at Seven Gables Series

"Important maritime landmarks dot the coastline. The House of the Seven Gables has been one for four centuries. Even more important to maritime safety, America’s lighthouses have kept countless ships from wrecking, saved untold lives, and contributed mightily to the growth and prosperity of the nation. Eric Jay Dolin, the author of Leviathan: The History of Whaling in America, will share the dramatic story of these soaring coastal sentinels, using numerous slides to illuminate the beauty and grandeur of America’s lighthouses. It is a riveting tale of nasty political battles, technological innovation, natural disasters, and war. But most of all it is a story about the male and female keepers, who, often with the invaluable assistance of their families, faithfully kept the lights shining and the fog signals blaring. A book signing for Brilliant Beacons will follow the talk.

Eric Jay Dolin is the author of Leviathan: The History of Whaling In America, which was chosen as one of the best nonfiction books of 2007 by The Los Angeles Times and The Boston Globe, and also won the 2007 John Lyman Award for U. S. Maritime History; and Fur, Fortune, and Empire: The Epic History of the Fur Trade in America, which was chosen by The Seattle Times as one of the best nonfiction books of 2010, and also won the James P. Hanlan Book Award, given by the New England Historical Association. He is also the author of When America First Met China: An Exotic History of Tea, Drugs, and Money in the Age of Sail, which was chosen by Kirkus Reviews as one of the 100 best nonfiction books of 2012. A graduate of Brown, Yale, and MIT, where he received his Ph.D. in environmental policy, Dolin lives in Marblehead, Massachusetts, with his family. For more information on his background, books, and awards, please visit ericjaydolin.com. You can also follow Dolin’s posts on Facebook on his author page, at Eric Jay Dolin."

Members: Free

Non-Members: $7.00 per person

To reserve your spot for this lecture please email [masked], or call[masked] ext. 104

results.description:
We'll be attending the event on the Syrian refugee crisis co-sponsored by Oxfam and Microsoft. Whoever wants to join us to grab drinks afterwards at Aeronaut Brewery is welcome to! Event info:

Hosted by Oxfam and Microsoft at the Microsoft NERD Center, “The Refugee Road” is a unique and experiential opportunity for participants to engage with the powerful themes of choice, loss, and uncertainty. Syria’s war—described by the UN as “the worst humanitarian crisis of our time”—has forced more than 11.4 million people to flee their homes and make a dangerous journey in pursuit of better lives for their families. Join us as we experience and discover the realities of this dangerous journey. Doors open at 5:30pm. Program begins promptly at 6:00pm. Hosts, WCVB Anchors, Erica Tarantal and Doug Meehan will guide the program. Humanitarian experts will be present to discuss the crisis. Refreshments served.
results.how_to_find_us: Please use the group comments section to find one another.
results.name: Learn about the Syrian Refugee Crisis at an interactive event

results.description:
ME BEFORE YOU
RELEASE DATE:

June 03, 2016
RATED:

PG-13


SYNOPSIS:

Louisa Lou Clark (Clarke) lives in a quaint town in the English countryside. With no clear direction in her life, the quirky and creative 26-year-old goes from one job to the next in order to help her tight-knit family make ends meet. Her normally cheery outlook is put to the test, however, when she faces her newest career challenge. Taking a job at the local castle, she becomes caregiver and companion to Will Traynor (Claflin), a wealthy young banker who became wheelchair bound in an accident two years prior, and whose whole world changed dramatically in the blink of an eye. No longer the adventurous soul he once was, the now cynical Will has all but given up. That is until Lou determines to show him that life is worth living. Embarking together on a series of adventures, both Lou and Will get more than they bargained for, and find their lives—and hearts—changing in ways neither one could have imagined.

https://youtu.be/z3c5iIYUviI

Our usual schedule is

• 6-7:00pm Focused discussion and work on our topic for the week. In addition to discussion of the theory, we really want to do exercises and make progress on real problems.


• 7-7:30pm Conclude and set individual goals for next meeting 


• 7:30-... Chat, mingle and leave whenever

Please bring something to write with and on.

results.description:
We're a bunch of folks with extremely varied levels of kickball skill - whether you're a star athlete or were picked last in gradeschool kickball, it's a great time! Just be a good sport and come wearing your drinking shoes for some post-game festivities. Charge is very nominal for kickball games - only a 1-time fee of $5 to help cover equipment costs.

We'll be playing at Cambridge Common, accessible by bus or train. Its near the Harvard T stop. This is a great location and has many options for after game refreshments. Here's the exact location of where we meet to play: https://goo.gl/maps/HannXwVFJmT2


To get to the Common: From the Harvard T stop find the Harvard Coop and if you are facing the Coop as if you were going into it, you will need to walk in the right hand direction up mass ave from there. You will pass a CVS, Cest Bon Convenience store, T-Mobile, Body Shop then a Church on Church St and the intersection after the church and graveyard you will find a bus stop with a covered bench on Garden St. After that point you will cross over one last street and walk straight ahead, into the Common - we generally nab space at the far end, on the corner of Mass Ave & Waterhouse St. If you can't make it right at 5:45, no worries! We'll play til it's dark, so just join in when you can.

results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
This session covers the nuts and bolts of real estate investing, and draws on interviews with local investors and lenders. We'll review several real-life examples of completed projects (a condo conversion and a "buy and hold" property) and work through one possible investment together.

This workshop is very interactive and useful both for those looking to get started in real estate investing and people who own a few properties and want to get more information. We'll talk about the tax aspects of real estate investing, present a financing overview, and discuss skills needed and "lessons learned" from local investors.

Following the workshop, I'll provide attendees with a link to the full presentation and to numerous additional resources for locating, evaluating, and closing investments.

These workshops are a community service of ePlace, Inc., a real estate brokerage firm in Cambridge and are run by Rachael Burger, a real estate investor, educator, licensed broker and former agent.

This workshop runs from 6:00 - 7:30. Email [masked] or read what people are saying about Real Estate Investing.

results.description:
Charleene's Country Line Dance Lessons take place Wednesdays in Weymouth (OR Angela hosts the Tuesdays in Braintree) and she has a great team helping her teach the classes. Beginner lessons @ 6-7pm and Advanced lessons @ 7-8pm. This is a fun way to learn several country line dances with others and get in a nice workout. You'll then be able to join in the fun when you are out and see other people line dancing. 

What to Bring/Wear:

~Water (they do not provide drinks and you will get thirsty)

~Cowboy Boots (if you have them), boots or shoes w/ heels; no sneakers!

~Comfy Clothes (remember, you're dancing!)

Cost is $10 cash ONLY.

Please plan to arrive a few minutes early if this is your first time attending. This way you can pay at the register and we can get introduced before the fun starts.

Inclement Weather Reschedule Date: TBD; FYI - This happens weekly and they don't dance if the governor says to stay off the road.


Parking: Free and ample parking on-site.

The latest chapter in the emerging narrative of the IoT Super-Cluster in MA takes us to Lowell, where robotics, autonomous vehicles and their critical enabling technologies are born and commercialized.


For those embrace the breadth of opportunity that the instrumentation of the physical world (IoT) enables, this Meetup will explore the outer edge of distributed intelligence, autonomy and traditional organization disruption.


Our hosts, Tom O'Donnel, Steven Tello, Jacqueline Buckley and Lisa Armstrong will be collaborating with us to put together a compelling collection of regional research, startups, and case studies from leaders whose brands you will recognize.


SPEAKERS include:


George Clernon Senior Consultant, IoT Product Development Verizon Labs


Jeff Ruel Director, Business Development, Active Automotive Safety Systems Autoliv


Blandine Antoine Senior Manager, Corporate Development (IoT Solutions) iRobot


David Northup  Sales & Marketing Manager, Mobile Research Omron Adept MobileRobots, LLC

results.description:
• Do you want to increase the number of clients or customers you have?

• Would you like to convert more of your leads into clients or customers?

• Would it make sense to improve your ability to build relationships?

Come and join us on May 25 at 6:00 PM and learn from Dr. Nancy Zare, founder and CEO of Rapport Builderz, how to increase your sales by 300% using the AlikeAbility™ system.

In this presentation you will discover:

1. How to differentiate 4 buying styles

2. How to build rapport quickly and authentically, so you can develop effective relationships with all 4 buying styles

3. The formula for increasing your sales 300%

Dr. Nancy Zare, founder and CEO of Rapport Builderz, is the creator of the AlikeAbility™ system. She teaches people new approaches for quickly and authentically building rapport. This helps you communicate more effectively with your target audience in order to generate more business.

Dr. Zare is past president of the National Speakers Association of New England. She’s certified in accelerated learning and sales training. Her skill is in creating an engaging, interactive, and upbeat atmosphere to delight audiences.


By the end of this presentation you will:

1. Know the differences in how people make buying/hiring decisions

2. Know how to diagnose buying styles from the way people dress and talk

3. Know how to identify the mismatch between their buying style and your selling style

4. Know how to speak the language of your prospect and have the confidence you need to build rapport authentically and generate more business.

5. Have a 5-step system for tripling your sales

You will also have the chance to mix and mingle with new friends in the Boston business community in a relaxed environment. This is a great opportunity to meet business savvy individuals in your area to network, learn and connect as you build your reputation in your industry. It is also a powerful way to grow your business and referral network.

Dress is Business Casual.

We will be upstairs at The Point, 147 Hanover St. in Boston.

The Point is around the corner from Haymarket MBTA Station (Orange and Green Lines)

The Point is also behind the Parcel 7 Garage, 110 Sudbury St., where $1 per hour Validated Parking up to 3 hours is available.

results.description: Part of our Seven Lectures at Seven Gables Series Important maritime landmarks dot the coastline. The House of the Seven Gables has been one for four centuries. Even more important to maritime safety, America's lighthouses have kept countless ships from wrecking, saved untold lives, and contributed mightily to the growth and prosperity of the nation. Eric Jay Dolin, the author of Leviathan: The History of Whaling in America, will share the dramatic story of these soaring coastal sentinels, using numerous slides to illuminate the beauty and grandeur of America's lighthouses. It is a riveting tale of nasty political battles, technological innovation, natural disasters, and war. But most of all it is a story about the male and female keepers, who, often with the invaluable assistance of their families, faithfully kept the lights shining and the fog signals blaring. A book signing for Brilliant Beacons will follow the talk. Eric Jay Dolin is the author of Leviathan: The History of Whaling In America, which was chosen as one of the best nonfiction books of 2007 by The Los Angeles Times and The Boston Globe, and also won the 2007 John Lyman Award for U. S. Maritime History; and Fur, Fortune, and Empire: The Epic History of the Fur Trade in America, which was chosen by The Seattle Times as one of the best nonfiction books of 2010, and also won the James P. Hanlan Book Award, given by the New England Historical Association. He is also the author of When America First Met China: An Exotic History of Tea, Drugs, and Money in the Age of Sail, which was chosen by Kirkus Reviews as one of the 100 best nonfiction books of 2012. A graduate of Brown, Yale, and MIT, where he received his Ph.D. in environmental policy, Dolin lives in Marblehead, Massachusetts, with his family. For more information on his background, books, and awards, please visit ericjaydolin.com. You can also follow Dolin's posts on Facebook on his author page, at Eric Jay Dolin. Members: Free Non-Members: $7.00 per person To reserve your spot for this lecture please email [masked], or call[masked] ext. 104

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street

Performance Deep Dive


Gus Vargas, Hubspot

ImmutableJS

Colby Rabideau, Hubspot

results.description:
Four Success Stories on How to Return to Work After Long Career Breaks

We are thrilled to announce the participation of four professionals from the Biotech/Life Sciences/Phama sector who have successfully returned to work after long career breaks. Three panelists have experienced multi-year career breaks and one had a shorter career break of less than a year, but went through a career transition at the same time. Please join us for an exciting evening of diving into the most important factors for return-to-work success. 

Panelists
Indira Krishnan, 13 year career break, Research Fellow, Beth-Israel Deaconess Medical Center-Harvard Medical School
Enith Morillo, 9 year career break, Quality Assurance Consultant, Complya Consulting Group
Theresa Singleton, 8-month career break, Owner/Principal Scientific Writer, Singleton Science, LLC
Carol Waghorne, 10 year career break, Senior Curation Specialist, Intervention Insights

Moderator ---- Carol Fishman Cohen, CEO, iRelaunch (11 year career break)
results.name: Relaunching Careers in Biotech/Life Sciences/Pharma - How It's Done

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th)

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Tuesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 10th) 

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

League Format:

The format for the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League will be the same as last year – 7 weeks, 6 teams, 1-hour long matches, and restaurant specials after on-court play. Our first week will be a tennis jamboree open to everyone, weeks 2-6 will be round-robin team competition, week 7 will be an individual tournament unless utilized for rained-out match makeups.

Registration Details:

Registration for the league is through the Teamsnap mobile app or Teamsnap.com. Teamsnap is an easy-to-use social sports league application that:

1. Helps you save time communicating with your team on your phone 2. Provides you auto-notifications on schedule updates, changes and cancellations.  3. Allows you to send messages, send updates, track matches, share photos and more. Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League smartphone users are encouraged to download the Teamsnap application on their mobile devices.

USE THE LINK BELOW TO SIGN UP FOR TEAMSNAP AND REGISTER FOR THIS SPRING SEASON OF THE JACK’S ABBY SOCIAL TENNIS LEAGUE: https://go.teamsnap.com/divisions/72836/registration/24517/register/new

Don’t forget our referral program – We discount your registration fee $10.00 for every player who joins the league off your recommendation! 

Site Coordinator Search:

Interested in joining the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League team?  Become a site coordinator, or team captain! Being a site coordinator is fairly simple, and often fun! If interested, please email [masked] to discuss the location you’re interested in coordinating!

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

If you have any question, please contact Connie or Paul I., through the EMAIL LINK via BOSTON ASL profile page.

PLEASE, if you would be good enough, RSVP either "YES" or "NO" so I know who to look for!

CHEERS!

Paul I.

PEACE...
results.why: ASL is the third largest "foreign language" in the U.S.; ASL is fun to use; ASL is NOT English, but does "borrow" from the English language.
results.how_to_find_us: The folks talking with their hands!
results.name: Weekly North Shore ASL Social!

Hillview Golf Course is a regulation 18-hole golf course that is town owned by North Reading and managed by Golf Facilities Management, Inc. Hillview is a course where players of all levels will have a wonderful golfing experience, challenging for the expert and playable for the beginner. The player friendly course plays to 5773 yards from the blue tees, 5290 from the white tees, and 4521 from the red tee markers at which par is 69. Golfers will feel comfortable off the tee and will be challenged with their approach shots requiring precise shots into the greens.

In recent years, Hillview has undergone many extensive renovations. These renovations have improved course conditions, pace of play and the overall golfing experience at Hillview Golf Course. These renovations include many new greens, tees, and fairway landing areas. These projects funded by The Hillview Commission, have made Hillview Golf Course one of the best and affordable golfing experiences in the area. Come out and give us a try!

results.description:
Comparing Redux, Relay and Falcor for State Management - Naresh Bhatia

Managing application state has been a tough nut to crack – if you don’t have a good strategy, you will end up with a bowl of spaghetti. Frameworks like Redux, Relay and Falcor are taking the state management problem head-on. At a high level, they all attempt to provide a cleaner and more maintainable architecture, but their approaches are very different. I will explain the concepts behind each framework using a realistic Angular 2 example (don’t worry, not a to-do app!). We will look at pros and cons of each framework and the lessons that I learned during my experiments.

Speaker Bio

Naresh is a passionate technologist and architect who has spent his career helping developers write better software. He leads the Visualization Practice at Sapient Global Markets, which builds interfaces and data visualizations for financial institutions and energy firms.

------------------ 


Schedule:

6:00pm - Doors open for everyone; pizza and beverages available


6:30pm - ng-conf recap and Q&A

7pm - Naresh's talk, questions, discussion

8:15pm to 8:30pm - Networking, clean-up, bye!

------------------

Address: Bocoup, 201 South Street, Floor 1, Boston MA (Please use the back entrance on Utica Street.)

Google Maps:  
Map to closest parking
results.name: Comparing Redux, Relay and Falcor for State Management - Naresh Bhatia

results.description:
We had quite a tradition last year, of walking amongst the (sometimes surprising) nature at Horn Pond. Everyone walks at their own pace. Optional short trek up Mt. Tawanda, or break on through to the other side. Good exercise, but lots of wandering, chatting, laughing and wondering at the swans, geese, ducks, turtles, herons, and more!  We've seen all kinds of nesting waterfowl, spring babies, snapping turtles, rabbits, and other common creatures.  Some gorgeous sunsets as we're leaving. I fed the swans, ducks, and a mistake, the geese. They had chased me pecking, and they can haul. ps. the swan couple come back every year, and typically have around eight cygnets, nice Joan. Nature, and Darwinism  reigns, and about two, to four live to spread their wings. Beware of the snappers!

https://www.google.com/search?q=Horn+Pond,&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjWrLC0scDMAhWMOj4KHdk8C7QQsAQIKQ&biw=1680&bih=925#imgrc=hPCYJLvx9clT7M%3A
results.name: Nature Walk Deux - Horn Pond - Woburn, MA

results.description:
Come join us for a midweek climb!


To the left there is a chip-in feature. Your donations will go directly to the monthly dues and will allow MAC meetup group to keep going. Any amount would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~
results.how_to_find_us: Will meet at 6:30 PM at the cubbies by the stairs

Come join David and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford. This event is part of our "Wednesday Night Magic" series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that MTG Boston members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.
results.name: Wednesday Magic In Medford

results.description:
The book is The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian by Sherman Alexie.

The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian tells the story of Junior, a budding cartoonist growing up on the Spokane Indian Reservation. Determined to take his future into his own hands, Junior leaves his troubled school on the rez to attend an all-white farm town high school where the only other Indian is the school mascot. Heartbreaking, funny, and beautifully written, this semi-autobiographical novel chronicles the contemporary adolescence of one Native American boy as he attempts to break away from the destructive cycle of alcoholism, poverty, and crushed dreams.

The venue is Pho Hoa in Chinatown, a reasonably priced Vietnamese restaurant with nice, round tables and a quieter atmosphere.
results.name: The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian at Pho Hoa in Chinatown

Join us on this wonderful spring night in May, to meet new people and walk away with a variety of tools that you will be able to utilize immediately and in the future in your search for connection. The focus of this interactive workshop is how to experience more joy and greater success online with facebook, linked in and other social sites and In the process, you will learn how to:

- create fabulous online profiles

- better assess other people’s profiles

- write enticing emails to have people get the real you.

- move forward to further the connection through phone or email conversation. 

- Prepare for a fabulous first meeting.

Wine and cheese provided

Susan Trotter is a Professional Life Coach, with a focus on relationships. She also has a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology and has been a therapist for over 20 years. Her extensive background in psychology, therapy and coaching gives her a unique perspective in helping people who are looking to develop new relationships, strengthen existing relationships, or process past relationships. With a clear understanding of the importance of emotional well-being and connection, Susan is able to successfully coach her clients to achieve greater joy and satisfaction in their relationships and in all areas of their lives.

Susan can be reached at [masked] or at[masked]-0486. She can also be found on  Linked In  or on Facebook www.facebook.com/susantrotterphd.

results.description:
- RSVP now for Wed, May 25 -

- Why you should ditch your elevator speech (if you even have one)

                                                ........................

Our Regular Wed, May 25 Meetup:

If you're new to Speak Up Cambridge, what should you expect from our meetups?

Learn valuable do's and don'ts for addressing an audience. Listen to first-time speakers. And discover how to get over that "anxiety hurdle."

Did you ever imagine speaking to a group could be fun?

First-time (and returning) guests enjoy our simple exercises and learn useful techniques for connecting with an audience.

Our meet-ups are fast-paced and entertaining. Nobody feels intimidated. Come experience it for yourself: You'll get to listen to prepared speeches and learn simple yet effective speaking tips.

You are welcome to participate in our two-minute impromptu speaking exercises, but certainly not required. We do have a 30-second “Round Robin” that everyone participates in (it’s fun and easy), and you’ll probably be asked to introduce yourself [talk very briefly about an interest, or what brought you there]. Pretty basic, no surprises.  The only requirement is to enjoy yourself and get a sense of how the meet-ups run. [They start promptly at 6:50, so please arrive by or before 6:45. They end by 8:30 pm.]

We're planning another special meetup Wednesday, June 8, with verbal branding expert Stephen Melanson.

Let's face it: crafting an elevator speech - a clear, brief message that creates interest in a project, idea or in yourself (who you are, and what you're looking for) - is one tough assignment. Which explains why most of us avoid developing one. They're typically about 30 seconds, which approximates a typical attention span. Or does it?

Finally, here's a reason to throw away your elevator pitch (if you even have one).

Melanson believes they're too long, they provide description [vs position against the competition], and it's not a strategy to continue thru the rest of the conversation. “Branding books don’t recognize that the most important branding moments are conversations,”  he explains.

What's the answer?  Great verbal branding is direct, honest, and moves action. We'll learn how to intrigue our listener instead of losing their attention. Ever have that sinking feeling of watching your words fly past him/her?

Stephen Melanson is an entertaining and dynamic speaker. We'll start working on our personal branding statements in the previous meetup (May 25), and refine and revise them with Melanson at the special June 8 session.  The lessons you learn will stick with you for a long time to come.

  ........................

Mark Your Calendar - Our Next Meet-Ups:

Wed, June 8 (6:45 PM)

[Next "Second Saturday" AM session June 11.]

       ..............................

3rd Floor, Room 097.

You must take the elevator by the security desk to access the floor.

Parking: If you can't find street parking (Beware - Metered until 8 PM !), There is parking to the rear of the bldg. You will present ticket to the security desk on your way out ($3), then insert the ticket at the gate as you exit.
(Don't park in the supermarket/Porter Square shopping center parking lot.)


See the "About Us" tab for more info.
results.how_to_find_us: 3rd Floor, Room 097. You must take the elevator by the security desk to access the floor.
results.name: Sparkle When you Speak Wed May 25 [+ June 8]

results.description:
6:45-7:00 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

7:00 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field. Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field. Open to all levels of players. Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones with our discs out.

results.description:
Come join us for four lightning talks and presentations in our monthly one-hour mini-conference!

From 7 to 8, the floor is open for anyone to come talk about or present on something they find interesting.  Want to show off your latest startup?  How about a fun project you are working on the side?  Just want to convince everyone to start investing in BitCoin?  Come on down!  It's like a mini-TED conference. :-)

Presenters, please sign up by leaving a comment below to reserve a spot.  I will then update the list.  You will have access to wifi and a projector or monitor (please bring your own adapters).  Remember: these are lightning presentations to whet the appetite so you only have 15 minutes!

Afterwards, we'll head over to one of downtown Beverly's nearby bars or restaurants for a drink.

Current Presenters:

1. Mary Hopper - VR and Augmented Reality
2. Bruce MacKenzie - 3D Printing and Mars
3. Dag Holmboe - Raspberry Pi and Healthcare
4. Mark Henderson - Small scale GIS and Mapping

Backup Presenters: 

5. Steve Doroff

results.description:
Come join us on May 25th at the **CAMBRIDGE CIC** at 1 Broadway (near Kendall Square). There will be pizza and drink provided, courtesy of Mozilla. We will have two speakers:

- Steve Klabnik, member of the Rust core team and doc writer extraordinaire. Steve will talk about intermezzOS, his project to build an operating system in Rust. intermezzOS has a companion book teaching people introductory operating systems programming for x86_64, using assembly and Rust. He'll show off some code, talk about getting started with OSDev, and talk about the projects' future.

- Andrew Gallant, member of the Rust libs team and author of several popular Rust libraries, including regex and docopt. He will discuss how the regex library works and some of the neat tricks it uses for optimizations.

Hope to see you there!


**Location:** Venture Cafe at the Cambridge CIC. The venue is wheelchair accessible and easily reached by heading to Kendall Square on the T. (Note that prior events took place at the Boston CIC, which is a different place.)
results.how_to_find_us: Head to the 5th floor and follow signs to the Venture Cafe.

Teacher and student of Raja Yoga for 36 years

results.description:
In Becoming Nicole: The Transformation of an American Family, Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Amy Ellis Nutt chronicles the story of the Maines family, a middle-class American family that is ordinary but for one exception: one of their identical twin sons, given the name Wyatt at birth, began identifying as a girl at the age of two. Jonas was all boy. But Wyatt was just the opposite, interested only in girls' clothes and toys. The family struggled with what this might mean, initially hoping that Wyatt was passing through a phase. However, by age five, Wyatt's inner conflict began tearing him and the family apart. The Maines family sought out Dr. Norman Spack, co-founder of the nation's first clinic to treat transgender children, and began a journey full of discovery and change.

Join us for a special evening with Nicole, Jonas, and Dr. Spack as they discuss the milestones in the family's life, Nicole's transition, and the twins' first year of college. Book signing to follow.

Tickets are free, but must be reserved at mos.org/public-events/becoming-nicole, starting May 11th (May 9th for museum members).
results.name: Becoming Nicole

results.description:
On the fourth Wednesday of each month, BACA (Boston Association of Cabaret Artists) hosts an evening of Open Mic Cabaret. Cabaret, jazz, torch songs and show tunes are typical for these evenings, but other reasonable genres include pop, soul, folk, soft rock, ballads, etc.

If you want to belt out a song or two, or just come to watch and support all levels of performers, please join us at this very friendly and fun evening.

Admission is $10/$13/$7 (members/singers/audience). Where else in Boston can you get so much entertainment for such a low price? *You may want to inquire about BACA's $40 annual membership for cost savings on events as well as other wonderful benefits!.

Sign-ups to sing and the show begins at 7pm (the earlier you arrive, the more of a chance you can sing two songs!). Also, in order to sing, you will need to bring sheet music so the pianist can accompany you, optimally in your key.

The Venue:

Two blocks from Watertown Square.
Mass Pike Exit 17, go north on Centre/Galen St, left on Main St, right on Church St.
By public transit, many buses go there, including #71 from Harvard Square.
Many restaurants within easy walk.
FREE parking available in the bank lot adjacent to the church off Summer St., additional free parking on Summer St. If no lot or street parking available, there is a large municipal parking lot one block away between Church and Spring Streets behind the CVS and Stellina's restaurant.
Church has Steinway Model B grand piano and concert acoustics.
FYI the church's web site: http://fpwatertown.org
Google Map and Directions: http://goo.gl/maps/8MBJp

Please come by, say hello, and enjoy the show!

Cheers,
results.name: BACA Cabaret Open Mic Night at Watertown Square

results.description:
Have you ever tried to make change and then found yourself falling back again into old patterns?  

Does the fear of not being good enough, or losing what you have, or not knowing what comes next stop you in your tracks? 

Then you're running into resistances!

Our Topic This Evening...

... will be how to overcome your inner resistance

Resistances are sneaky little thought-worms that get into your brain and shut you down from the process of change.  In this class, we'll lay out the major types of resistances and how to break through them into the change you desire.

This class is for those who are serious about making change but who keep getting in their own way when they try to do it.

You'll Learn:

• What the major types of resistances are - both mental/emotional and energetic 

• The secret to clearing each type of resistance so you can soar forward 

• The one major pitfall that you REALLY want to avoid when trying to make change in your life. 

Don't miss this powerful life-changing class.  It will blow you away and get you moving forward quickly.

Please do not wear fragrances!  Kelle is allergic to most fragrances (yes, even essential oils), so please don't wear them. 

Our Leaders This Evening

Kathy Scheiern

Kathy is a transformational shaman, with a PhD in the dynamics of transformation and over 20 years of experience creating and facilitating transformational experiences. She loves helping people make powerful, positive change in their life. :-)

Kelle Sparta

Kelle is a thought alchemist, shaman, and coach. She has been studying personal growth, mysticism, religion, psychic skills, and more since she was 7 years old.  She is a psychic, a channel, and a medium.


She helps people find a balance between the divine masculine and the divine feminine within themselves. This integration opens up a person's energies to allow the completion of their life's mission.

results.description:
There have been a couple (hundred) articles recently pointing out the tendency for a democracy to start working against itself. It was Plato's idea 2400 years ago in the Republic. Short article:
http://betweenthetimes.com/index.php/2016/03/15/platos-republic-american-democracy-and-donald-trump/

Long article:
http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2016/04/america-tyranny-donald-trump.html

If the highest goods of a democratic society are freedom and equality, what could go wrong? Plato's ideal was vastly different from what is in place in America - how has social media moved out political system? How would America be different if we were ruled by an elected group of highly trained/educated politicians?

idea credit: Max

results.description:
We are super excited about opening night at Red Heat Tavern. Cheers, and please invite everyone you know! 


Running for Brews is 100% free to join and is all about good beer and meeting new people!


Running for Brews is all about those who enjoy getting out and breaking a sweat amongst the company of other fellow runners and then topping it off with an awesome craft brew and some great conversation. We meet up and then proceed to run a beautiful 5k route to earn some delicious brews! 


All levels of runners (or walkers) are welcome!
Day/Time: Wednesday, 7pm 

Location: Red Heat Tavern - Bedford Location

How long is the run? Most run a pre-planned 5k (3 mile) route, but you can run, walk or jog less or more!

All runners MUST sign our ONE-TIME, online waiver!

Please contact the administrator for more details or if you have questions. Thank you and happy running! www.RunningforBrews.com

Follow us on Instagram - https://instagram.com/RunningforBrews & https://www.instagram.com/rfbbedford/

Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/RFBBedford & https://twitter.com/RunningforBrews

Follow us on Pinterest - http://pinterest.com/runningforbrews/

~Running for Brews Crew

results.description:
We'll meet up on the track and do some speed work. This is great workout for runners of ALL levels, so it doesn't matter if you're trying to break a 35:00 5K or a 20:00 5K. This will help! :) This week Jae has prescribed a Pyramid workout, which is a challenging set of intervals that gradually increases, then decreases:


- Warm up run (own your own)
- Stretches (on your own)
- Pyramid Work out: (Recover between each interval)
- 200 M
- 400 M
- 800 M
- 1600 M (option 1200 M)
- 800 M
- 400 M
- 200 M
- Option 6x100 M (Focus on Form)
- Cool down and stretches (on your own)

"For Ezra had set his heart to study the Law of the Lord, and to do it and to teach his statutes and rules in Israel" (Ezra 7:10).

Ezra is a book about a God who keeps His promises and His people who learn how to trust and obey Him after generations of faithlessness with the help of a dedicated student and teacher of the word.

Come check out this timeless book that connects the prophecies concerning the house of David and the coming of Jesus, the Son of David!  Bring your Bible or grab a Bible at the door and join in the discussion!

results.description:
**RSVP is requested, please go to the event page here to register: Location is given after RSVP.

http://www.meetup.com/bodysoulsound/events/228798650/

Immerse yourself in sacred space of sound, vibration, drumming, and meditation with customized herb tea. Allow yourself, with grace, to leave all the week's stress, thoughts and self-doubts behind, and allow the soothing and unique sound of each Tibetan bowl to move through you and release tension, toxins and emotional stress.

Each Tibetan bowl and its healing frequency corresponds to each chakra and its own frequency, for balancing, healing, and raising of your vibration. The sacred space is about co-creation and the peeling of layers that allow you to illuminate your true self, seeing yourself through the eyes of the heart. Cultivating presence.

We will start with cordials, and/or tea meditation.

* Partaking in a tea ceremony and/or cordial/tincture is not required, but recommended. If choosing to ingest, please refrain from solid food at least two hours prior to session, and 24 hours refraining of any dairy product. About iLan Teas: In working with different plants and herbs, I have put together a mix that is unique in bringing you to being present and an expansion of the heart, body, mind and spirit, depending on your intention and the intended tea mix.

The loose leaf tea is made from the highest quality, organic grade bulks and I personally prepare the mixes with love for what I do, and devotion to the healing properties of each herb. The herbs have been used for centuries by indigenous for healing and cleansing, and drawing from my own family heritage of wise-woman-tradition, I am grateful to share the knowledge and teachings with the combination of sound and vibration.

About Tinctures/Cordials:

Tinctures and cordials contain Alcohol and/or honey. The plants were fermented for over 30 days and their specific healing qualities are preserved and amplified. * Private and group sessions available. * Financial exchange is $30 early bird, and $35 at the door. * Participation is limited to 10 so please sign up and RSVP.

- Please bring an eye cover, and a blanket for personal comfort. Love and light, -iLan
results.name: Sacred sound bath & herb tea meditation

results.description:
Botany, or the study of plant biology, is one of the oldest branches of science. Originated by herbalists in medieval times, botany was developed to help share specific information about medicinal and poisonous species of plants. We can think of botany as a form of communication, and knowing the language of plant taxonomy can aid us in learning about plant medicines.

In order to work with herbs safely and effectively, we need to be sure that we have identified our plants correctly. A basic understanding of plant science can help us to be more accurate identifiers. Knowing some simple botany can also help us to distinguish our Eupatorium perfoliatum from our Eupatorium purpureum – that is, to know our boneset from our gravel root.


So if all this Latin plant nomenclature sounds like Greek to you, we have got you covered! Join us for this introduction to plant biology, in an herbalist- and naturalist-friendly format.

Wednesday, May 25th, 2016
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

RSVP by filling out our contact form or emailing us at [masked].

http://commonwealthherbs.com/herbal-botany-class/
results.name: Botany For Herbalists

results.description:
Join the Boston Austrian Economics Group as we embark upon Chapter 22: The Nonhuman Original Factors of Production, (a bit dry for an event title, so I called this one "Land!"), from the Austrian classic; "Human Action: A Treatise on Economics," by Ludwig von Mises. The group will discuss the weekly reading and questions.

Please note the readings are not required to attend our meeting, but are recommended. As always, anyone interested in economics is welcome.


Fuji has plenty of parking and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop.


Please feel free to call Andrew at (917)[masked] with any questions.

NOTE: There will be no meeting on Wednesday, May 18.


READING: 

Human Action, Part 4, Chapter 22: The Nonhuman Original Factors of Production

Study Guide to Human Action by Robert P. Murphy

STUDY QUESTIONS:

1. What is the greatest merit of the Ricardian theory of rent, according to Mises?

2. How is the factor of time important for the utilization of land?

3. Which institutional conditions can affect the utilization of land?

4. What is the value of submarginal land?

5. How do the prices of land differ from those of other factors of production?

6. What is the myth of the soil?

7. Why are land and the services it renders dealt with in the same way as other factors of production and their services?

8. Under which conditions would an increase in the amount of land increase the supply of cereals, etc.?

9. What would a land cartel look like?

10. What would the consequences be of abolishing recurring payments for land rent? What would the consequences be of monopolizing recurring payments for land rent under the state?
results.how_to_find_us: We will be the table with the papers on it.
results.name: Land!

results.description:
This is our dress rehearsal for our performance on June 1st!

Come and join us at our weekly rehearsal! All you need is you and your instrument. New members are always welcome. Please post a comment if you have any questions. 


Free parking is available in the Devotion School garage on Steadman Street.  To get there from Coolidge Corner, go one block, past Steadman Street to Beals Street (look for JFK Birthplace sign) and turn right.  Go past the John F. Kennedy birthplace home and make a U-turn, right, on to Steadman Street.  The garage is located past the Devotion playground, on the left.  We normally rehearse in the auditorium on the third floor.  The band meets most Wednesdays when school is in session.

"Unearth the Deception" and help stop the forces of Elemental Evil from plunging the Sword Coast into chaos. Designed to take players from level 1 to level 5 by the time the season ends in August, this is a great way to (re)introduce yourself to D&D's current edition and get immersed in a storyline that harks back to the origins of the game.

Pre-generated characters are available, as is help to build your own, so feel free to drop in or contact Ted Atkinson if you'd like more information.
