results.description:
So this is going to be the first of the "rebooted" Boston Groovy, Grails & Spring Meetup. I'll be giving a Talk Intro to Grails 3. I will be broadcasting the Meetup over Google Hangouts, for those who can't make it out, or if we actually meet our capacity:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KBJLDyMl61g 

You will be able to find the code for the presentation here:
https://github.com/virtualdogbert/Grails3Tutorial


For those driving in:
"The easiest parking option is the parking garage behind (north of) 1 Kendal Square on Binney Street , although there's many others in close proximity."


Doors open at 6:30PM, Meetup starts at 7PM. When you arrive ring the doorbell, and we'll let you in.


• Doors open, settle in, mingle, and network.

• Announcements(5-10min)    
     • Thank the host    
     • Jobs(but only from actual people, no recruiters/head hunters)    
     • Looking for speakers for full talks or lightning talks
     • Looking for other location hosts
     • Asking what people would like to see for talks     
     • Misc(other meetups, conference, etc) 

• Main Talk(30min)
    • Break(10-15min)
• Main Talk(30min)

• After meetup we may go out to a local spot for drinks, and continued conversation.

If you sigh up and find you can't make it, please change your rsvp, and try not to do that last minute, if it can be avoided.

If you are attending through the hangout, please don't RSVP for the meetup, because that reserve a spot for the face to face meetup. Although it is nice to see people are chiming in on the comments that they are going to attend remotely.

Thanks.

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

results.description:
Have you ever tried to make change and then found yourself falling back again into old patterns?  

Does the fear of not being good enough, or losing what you have, or not knowing what comes next stop you in your tracks? 

Then you're running into resistances!

Resistances are sneaky little thought-worms that get into your brain and shut you down from the process of change.  In this class, we'll lay out the major types of resistances and how to break through them into the change you desire.

This class is for those who are serious about making change but who keep getting in their own way when they try to do it.

You'll Learn:

• What the major types of resistances are - both mental/emotional and energetic 

• The secret to clearing each type of resistance so you can soar forward 

• The one major pitfall that you REALLY want to avoid when trying to make change in your life. 

Don't miss this powerful life-changing class.  It will blow you away and get you moving forward quickly.

We WILL START ON TIME - So if you don't want to miss anything, you'll want to arrive early.

Don't Wait To Register - Our classes tend to sell out well in advance of the class time.  We are promoting this event on multiple Meetups.  Register now to save your space.

Please do not wear fragrances!  Kelle is allergic to most fragrances (yes, even essential oils), so please don't wear them.
results.name: Overcoming Your Resistance To Change

The loose leaf tea is made from the highest quality, organic grade bulks and I personally prepare the mixes with love for what I do, and devotion to the healing properties of each herb. The herbs have been used for centuries by indigenous for healing and cleansing, and drawing from my own family heritage of wise-woman-tradition, I am grateful to share the knowledge and teachings with the combination of sound and vibration.

About Tinctures/Cordials:

Tinctures and cordials contain Alcohol and/or honey. The plants were fermented for over 30 days and their specific healing qualities are preserved and amplified.


* Private and group sessions available.


* Financial exchange is $30 early bird, and $35 at the door.


* Participation is limited to 10 so please sign up and RSVP.

- Please bring an eye cover, and a blanket for personal comfort.

Love and light, 

-iLan

results.description:
Have you ever tried to make change and then found yourself falling back again into old patterns?  

Does the fear of not being good enough, or losing what you have, or not knowing what comes next stop you in your tracks?


Then you're running into resistances!

Resistances are sneaky little thought-worms that get into your brain and shut you down from the process of change.  In this class, we'll lay out the major types of resistances and how to break through them into the change you desire.

This class is for those who are serious about making change but who keep getting in their own way when they try to do it.

You'll Learn:

• What the major types of resistances are - both mental/emotional and energetic

• The secret to clearing each type of resistance so you can soar forward

• The one major pitfall that you REALLY want to avoid when trying to make change in your life.


Don't miss this powerful life-changing class.  It will blow you away and get you moving forward quickly.


We WILL Start On Time!  So if you don't want to miss anything, you'll want to arrive a little early,

Don't Wait To Register - Our classes tend to sell out well in advance of the class time.  This event is being promoted on multiple Meetups.  Register now to save your space.

Please do not wear fragrances!  Kelle is allergic to most fragrances (yes, even essential oils), so please don't wear them.
results.name: Overcoming Your Resistance to Change

results.description:
Wednesday night is our (almost) weekly get-together for open gaming at the Panera Bread location in Porter Square. All are welcome to join us, regardless of experience level!


If you have a game you are particularly interested in playing, you are welcome and encouraged to bring it. But this is not required; many people typically bring a selection of their favorites and we're always happy to teach. The only things you need to bring are an open mind and a good attitude. If you're particularly hot to try something out, you are encouraged to leave a comment and see if you can drum up some interest beforehand. Please bear in mind that table space is limited, so an especially huge or epic game may not be appropriate for the venue (but see our Sunday night event at Pandemonium in Central Square for an alternative venue).


The event officially opens at 7 PM, but some people like to show up early; those who show up early should feel free to get started on a shorter warm-up game if time allows.


We look forward to seeing you at the gaming table!


WHERE WE SIT: Unless the restaurant is super-crowded, we gather in the basement dining area; just look for the games and say hi. We're friendly, honest!


GETTING THERE:


The Panera is located within easy walking distance of the Red Line T and several bus lines, and public transit is probably the easiest way of getting there. If you drive, mall parking is (theoretically) limited to 2 hours except where posted. I've never heard of anyone getting towed for overstaying this limit. For the extra-cautious, there are metered spots on Mass Ave; check the meter to be sure but most Cambridge meters don't need to be fed after 6 PM or 7 PM. There is also a Hubway bike-share station less than five minute's walk from the mall.


SOME NOTES:


As a group, we don't usually make a huge deal about attendance policy, however: attendance at these events is limited, and our Panera events are usually not huge; one side effect of this is that RSVPing and then not showing up can have a disruptive effect on our events, and for particularly popular events, "no shows" take up a spot from someone who wanted to be there. Bottom line: If you RSVP for a Panera event, please make a good-faith effort to show up or at least let us know if you can't make it.


As far as possible, please also let us know if you're going to be more than a few minutes late. As a rule of thumb, if we haven't heard from you and you arrive after 7:15 or so, you're likely to be limited to a spot at whatever game has room for an extra player. Much later than that, and we'll almost certainly be underway without you! You're welcome to show up and socialize and of course we'll try to accomodate you if we can, but we can't guarantee you a game. Because we as a group tend to play longer and more involved games, most groups at our events tend to play one and only one game per night.


Panera has been quite gracious about hosting our group with minimal fuss. To ensure that this happy state of affairs continues, please give them some business if you're hungry or thirsty and (especially) respect the hardworking people who work there, and their desire to go home after a long shift -- be ready to leave when the restaurant closes at ten.
results.name: Wednesday Gaming In Porter Square

results.description:
Next up is Sandman Overture, by Neil Gaiman! We're doing it on a Wednesday again.


I was utterly blown away by the artwork. I look forward to discussing it with you all


The Bumf:

THE SANDMAN: OVERTURE heralds New York Times best-selling writer Neil Gaiman's return to the art form that made him famous, ably abetted by artistic luminary JH Williams III (BATWOMAN, PROMETHEA), whose lush, widescreen images provide an epic scope to The Sandman's origin story. From the birth of a galaxy to the moment that Morpheus is captured, THE SANDMAN: OVERTURE will feature cameo appearances by fan-favorite characters such as The Corinthian, Merv Pumpkinhead and, of course, the Dream King's siblings: Death, Desire, Despair, Delirium, Destruction and Destiny.


For those who haven't been to the Comic Book Club before, it's pretty simple - we sit around, order some food and some drink, and we probe deep into the merits and meanings of our chosen book or books. At the end we go around and give the book a rating out of 10.

If you're running late, please post a comment on the page for this meetup; in order to get a table at the Friendly Toast, we need to tell them how many people we have, so if you aren't there and you don't let us know what's up, we may not have space for you!

Normally we wait on the couches at the front until we have a quorum. If you are running late, look for the group with comics on the table! Most of the time we end up in one of the booths on the left.
results.name: Sandman Overture, by Neil Gaiman

results.description:
Two PyCon-bound speakers will rehearse their talks.

Giles Hall: Laser Cutters, 3D Printers, and Python

How to leverage python to generate physical, tangible things. We will discuss the basics of laser cutters, 3D printers, and how you can use python to design physical objects. After a brief introduction to these technologies, we will explore a few different examples of how we can use python to generate designs suitable for 3D printing and laser cutting.  More info...


Thomas Ballinger: Finding closure with closures

What are closures all about anyway, and why is there a new keyword in Python 3? We'll look at what a closure is, their history in the Python language, what the Python 3 nonlocal keyword is about, and examine how closures are idiomatically used (and avoided) in Python.  More info...

Pizza will be provided.

Because these are rehearsals, we will not be recording.  You'll be able to see the recording from the actual presentation given at PyCon.
results.how_to_find_us: 8th floor, Hatch Fenway: http://hatchfenway.com/
results.name: PyCon Rehearsals 4: Laser Cutters, and Closures

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability, so you actually get your work done and turn your dreams into reality

• Ideas and inspiration to help you make something new or improve what you already have

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall. No pressure at all. Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it (although we will say hello to you and give you the opportunity to introduce yourself, if you'd like).

Meeting Agenda:

7:00pm Join the meeting here:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/daviddrayton.com/weeklyautomatedincomemastermindmeeting

Each week, we do two things at our remote meetings, which we hold through Google Hangouts:

1) Part 1: Status check-ups (20-30 minutes): New members introduce themselves, sharing a bit about their goals and what they hope to get out of the group.  Existing members updates the group on the past week's biggest wins, and provide any other updates that stood out to them that week.

Each member may ask a short question or solicit help from the group as a whole before moving onto the next person, though any topics that deserve more than a minute or two of discussion will be moved to the next part of the meeting.

2) Part 2: Focus Groups (60 minutes+): The group splits out into two focus groups: one focused on selling physical products through platforms, and the other focused on producing and marketing online content.  Examples of the former may include people selling products on Amazon, Etsy, Ebay, through their e-commerce stores, etc.  Examples of the latter would include podcasters, bloggers, affiliate marketers, etc.

This second portion of the meeting may last for as long as the members within that focus group would like to extend the conversation, and members may hop on and off of either conversation at any time.

If you are in the physical product group, you can stay put in your current Google Hangout.  If you're in the online content marketing group, please join this hangout once Part 2 of the meeting begins:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea



Anyone can join. It doesn't matter where you are, how older you are, or even what stage of your business you're in. Our regular members include everyone from total beginners who are just getting their feet wet all the way up to serial entrepreneurs who are already making six-figures or more in their spare time doing this stuff.
results.how_to_find_us: Google Hangouts.  JOIN BY GOING TO  THIS LINK:  http://bit.ly/1XagvaN .  Note: you won't be able to join until the moderator has joined, so don't get discouraged if you see "Cannot join meeting."  Just try again in a minute or two.
results.name: Weekly Remote Mastermind Session

Update: Julie Fraser will now be leading a Lovingkindness meditation this night.  Unfortunately, Rick L will not be available to lead drumming.  Stay tuned, he will reschedule. 

Please be aware that we now have two different Ten Thousand Villages stores that host our events.  Make sure that you are going to the correct store.   This event is in Central Square Cambridge. 


We welcome you to arrive early to settle in, around 7pm is a good time because we do lock the door right at 7:15.  Our official event start time is now 7:15pm. 


Our schedule: 


7pm - It's great to arrive early to ask questions and find a good seat. We have chitchat time starting around 7:00. Come hang out with us, ask the teacher questions, and feel free to peruse the store.
7:15pm - Class starts.
Please note: We lock the door at 7:15pm so make sure to arrive early.  Please do not disturb the class by trying to enter or knocking.
8:30pm - Class ends. 

What happens during class: 
   The 75 minutes that we spend together will include: 
           1) discussion about meditation and mindfulness 
           2) instructions on how to meditate 
           3) experience the Lovingkindness meditation 
The length of the meditation itself will probably be about 15 to 25 minutes long. No previous experience is required; the meditation will be easy for beginners to understand. 


More info:
Our website has more information about the history of our Community Meditation Nights.
http://www.mindfulboston.com/classes/#/community-meditation-nights/ 

What to bring:
It's fine to just show up as you are. 


Yet, please be aware that (as you can see in the pictures) most of us do sit on the floor. Some folks choose to bring their own pillow for sitting on the floor, but there are no requirements to bring anything.

If you require a chair for health reasons, make sure to RSVP and write "please reserve a chair for me" in the comments section below. We have about seven chairs.

results.description:
Emily Haviland Baker is a locally-grown, up-and-coming performer & music therapist in the Greater-Boston area. She was raised in the Essex County in Massachusetts, and was born into a family of musicians. With her parent's being a classical pianist and a classical trumpet-player, and her Aunt being a professional violinist in New York City, Emily also chose to play the violin at the age of five. She started with the Suzuki method and moved onto a more vigorous path of studying viola at New England Conservatory Preparatory School from 2002 - 2006. There she studied with Gillian Rogel in her final year, and was in Benjamin Zander's Youth Philharmonic Orchestra for her last two. (Some of her other accomplishments during this time: In 2005, Emily received first chair in Massachusetts All-States Orchestra, and also went on a 3 week-long tour of Brazil and Venezuela in 2005 with NEC's YPO.) Emily studied classical viola for one final year in from[masked] with New England Conservatory's James Buswell. 

After a life-evaluation at the age of 18, Emily decided to step away from music and two years later, entered the corporate-world in an administrative role. Her final two and-a-half years were served as the Administrative Assistant to the SVP of Product at Sperry, a men's & women's footwear brand. Another life evaluation was due after year five in the corporate-gig, which is when Emily decided to return to music, newly inspired by the folk and bluegrass scene. After receiving a scholarship to Berklee College of Music and shortly after becoming a full-time student again, she realized that not only was performing in her future, but so was serving her community, and that would be through the channel of music therapy. Now, Emily is in her fifth semester at Berklee College of Music, dual-majoring in Music Therapy & Violin Performance with a Minor in American Roots Studies. There, she is studying with famous performers like Darol Anger, Bruce Molsky, Matt Glaser, Joe Walsh, Dr. David Wallace, Dave Hollander, Tony Trischka, and Casey Driessen. Emily has performed at an array of different venues, ranging from halls such as New England Conservatory's Jordan Hall and Boston's infamous Symphony Hall, to venues like the Cantab Lounge & Club Passim in Cambridge, MA, and The Red Room in Boston. Emily's expected graduation date is May 2017 and hopes to receive her MT-BC license later that year.


As with all of notloB's 4th Wednesday concerts at the Armory, admission is free, donation ($5-10pp) is appreciated. Reservations can be made at http://www.eventbrite.com/o/notlob-music-6730833315

ABOUT THE CAFE
You can arrive as early as 6pm to enjoy the cafe's offerings, which include sandwiches/wraps, salads, coffee, teas and pastries as well as beer and wine.
Free parking in the back lot, on street (mind the signage) and two satellite lots.
MBTA: Arts at the Armory is approximately a 15 minute walk from Davis Square which is on the MBTA Red Line, or take either the 88 or 90 bus from Lechmere (Green Line) or Davis Square (Red Line). Get off at the Highland Avenue and Lowell Street stop. You can also get there from Sullivan Square (Orange Line) via the 90 bus. Get off at the Highland Avenue and Benton Road stop.
Bicycle: The Armory is four blocks from the Somerville Community Path.
Handicap accessible.

ABOUT NOTLOB MUSIC
Since 2007, notloB Music has presented close to 200 folk, old-time, bluegrass, progressive string band, world and Celtic concerts in unique venues throughout the greater Boston area.
Opt in to our mail list - http://tinyurl.com/notlobmail

results.description:
Join 50 or more dancers any Wednesday at Dance Freedom!!

We are the original barefoot weekly dance, continuously running for 47 years, that has spawned hundreds if not thousands of other dances around the world.

In a drug, alcohol, and shoe-free environment, we've been making friends and sharing safe and juicy dances for decades. Come join the fun!! Discover the joy of dancing in a totally non-judgmental atmosphere, where anything safe and respectful goes... dance by yourself, in a group, with a same or opposite sex partner, or even just chat and enjoy watching.

First time visitors are welcomed heartily! You decide what to pay in a range from $10 to $20, or less later in the evening as the event nears its end (information on late admission discounts is at the door). Our friendly dancers range from utterly new at it to very skilled dancers in many different styles. Dance with or alongside amazing dancers from local dance troupes as well as with ordinary good-hearted rug cutters. At work they may be doctors, lawyers, programmers, massage therapists, expressive therapists, artists, students, dog walkers, scientists, or anything else, but at heart they all love to dance.

The music runs the gamut: funk, world music, soul & r&b, house, trance, hip-hop, salsa, yoga music, jazz or swing, reggae, disco, you name it! Each DJ from our rotating list has a unique style, but we try to include something for everyone in every set. We keep a good balance in the music: familiar with unusual, timeless with current, melodic with drum-based, and positive lyrics with instrumentals--in all kinds of rhythms & styles! In any given evening, the world music parts of our dance are likely to include at least 3 or so of the following... African, Latin, Indian, Middle Eastern, Caribbean, zydeco, gypsy and much more. You'll hear everything from basic party music to very danceable songs with socially conscious lyrics, but you won't be hearing anything sexist, racist, violent, hating or otherwise divisive.

Start with a soothing stretch and warm up at 7:30, connect with the group and start to boogie at 7:50 with our first DJ of the evening, take a brief break at 8:50 for community announcements and a short unique performance or workshop then cut the rug again by 9:15 at the latest with the evening's second DJ, till 10:30--plenty of time for a great workout and some feel-good inspiration and respiration and perspiration!

At the beginning of each half of the evening's music, dancers  hold hands, and dance in a winding chain together.  (This dance was created from out of a drumming circle on the Cambridge Common in the sixties, after all, and some of that great political and community spirit still lives on here.) Then, it's all dance music, generally building in tempo to a crescendo, slowing down again for some more melodic and slow dance songs for a few minutes, then gradually building to a second crescendo. The second half of the evening's dance follows roughly the same pattern with a different DJ and style, and ends with another circle dance for those who enjoy it.

Dancers are always welcome to help with set-up or take-down, and get in free for doing so! It's a great chance to get to know the community better.  Welcome! For more information, E-mail: [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Opposite the Cambridge Common, see the Sheraton Hotel w/the big red letters COMMANDER on top.  Enter the stone church just left of hotel, @ entrance closest to hotel.  Follow the hall straight, left and right to the desk to sign in.

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.   

Buy The Books

What's the biggest challenge you're facing this year? (personal OR business-wise)

1. Getting more business?

2. Getting healthier?

3. Getting your finances in order?

4.  Finding qualified employees?

5. Making space for creativity in your life?

These are just some common issues, your concerns are specific to YOU. Feel free to join us for this breakfast social, where we will have a relaxed discussion and pool our knowledge and offer resources to help get you where you want to be this year!   

The Salem Small Business Social is designed for people who'd like a "drop-in" event, where they can make new connections, deepen existing social connections, and harness the power of collective knowledge and support to get through this thing called LIFE.  (Prince tribute, no apologies)

Show up with a positive attitude and a desire to grow.

p.s. if you need to drop in late or cut out early, no need to tell me, you're a grown-up!  The event may run through 9:30 or even 10:00 AM, if we're having a productive discussion.  No stress if you can't stay.

See you soon!

Denise

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Thursday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

Join NetCom Learning trainer, Vincent Suppa, along with Managed Learning Services leader NetCom Learning for a complimentary webinar on "Financial Literacy in 18 Minutes (Part 1) ".

What’s that? You want financial literacy and you only have eighteen minutes? Do you sometimes go to meetings without your company’s financial documents because you don’t fully understand them?

Well, in Italy they speak Italian and in France they speak French. But in business, they speak finance. Today’s webinar stars the Income Statement.

Date: 05/26/2016


Time: 1 P.M. Eastern Standard Time/ 10 A.M. Pacific Standard Time


Agenda:

» Why financial literacy is vital to professional fulfillment.

» The most important ratios calculated from the income statement.

» Fundamentals of reverse engineering an income statement to infer competitors’ strategy.

» Q&A with Vincent.

  To receive the link for the Virtual Meetup, REGISTER HERE

Please note that in addition to RSVP'ing to this Meetup, you must register to get access by clicking the register button above.
results.name: Virtual Meetup: Financial Literacy in 18 Minutes (Part 1)

results.description:
Lightning talks + Hack Night was a big hit last night, so we’re going to do it again! For the first 45 minutes, we're going to give members the opportunity to give short talks about anything. Yep, you heard it: speak about anything at all! We want to give members opportunities to practice their speaking skills and we'd like to invite attendees to talk about any topic they want. The talk doesn't have to be technical and the only requirement is that others should be able to learn something from it!


Following the lightning talks, we'll go back to regular hack night programming. Bring any projects you're working on or homework you have to do. Work on a code challenge from one of the many code challenge websites (codeeval, exercism.io, hackerank, etc.). Write a blog post, or just catch up on work or emails. 

The tentative schedule is as follows: 

6 - 6.30pm: Registration + Mingle
6.30 - 7.15pm: Lightning Talks
7.15 - 9pm: Hacking

We already have women signed up to talk (lineup to be posted later), but if you want to be on the waitlist to talk at our next event please email us at [masked] with the subject “Lightning Talks”. 

If you'd like to speak but don't have a topic in mind, let us know and we can help you brainstorm. The talks will be short so shouldn't require a lot of preparation.

Food & Drink will be provided. Looking forward to seeing you there!

Thank you to Pixability for hosting this event. We're very excited to have a host that is led by a Woman Founder & CEO: Bettina Hein. We're excited to announce that Bettina will be kicking off the lightning talks herself! 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bettina Hein is the Founder and CEO of Pixability, a video advertising technology company. A serial entrepreneur,Bettina has built successful technology companies in the United States and in Europe. Prior to Pixability, Bettina co-founded the Swiss-based speech software specialist SVOX AG, which was sold to Nuance Communications (NUAN) for $125 million.

In 2016 Bettina received Advertising Women of New York’s Changing the Game Awards; and in 2015 received Cynopsis Media’s Top Women in Digital Award. In 2014 Bettina was named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum; and in 2012 received the L'Oreal NEXT Generation Award, an entrepreneurial award that honors the top five women leading groundbreaking digital companies, and The Boston Business Journal’s “40 Under 40 Award.” Bettina is co-author of “Video Marketing For Dummies.” She holds a MS degree from MIT, a law degree from the University of Constance, and a business degree from the University of St. Gallen.
results.name: May Hack Night & Lightning Talks

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.

Every Thursday

Classes - Practice - Open Dance

Beginners Welcome!!
Men, Women, Singles, Couples

Beginners Class 6pm -7pm

Everyone Else Class 7pm-8pm


Open Dance & Practice 8pm - Until


The Original Steppers of Boston offer Certified Chicago Style Steppin' dance instruction for the new beginner to the seasoned stepper. We also host a supportive environment for steppers to practice and participate in an open dance to hone their dance skills.

We welcome you to stop by to get an idea of what Steppin' Chicago Style is all about. There is a $10 participation fee to get on the dance floor, first visit is FREE. A partner is encouraged, but not required.

Courtesy Note:: Please be on time.
Practice outside of class is expected and necessary.

Class attendance may be a prerequisite for the Royce Banks Steppin' Is A Lifestyle Workshops.

Full Bar!!  Free Parking!! Kitchen is Open!!

results.description:
Analytics.Club's Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer

About the Event:

Monthly Meet-N-Greet Mixer networking event is conducted every last Thursday of the month. This event will primarily focus on building networks to initiate good conversations on data science across different venues around the town.

The monthly event will be Networking only mixer(Just plain and simple networking with no long sales pitch or knowledge sessions) envisioned to keep local data science professionals connected. You will use the opportunity to exchange contact information, seek opportunities, and connect with fellow data science professionals and build deeper connected networks.

Goal: We hope you at least make 2 new contacts / event & spread the word on event so more and more data science professionals could leverage the opportunity to build their personal network.

When: Last Thursday of the Month

Time: 6:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.

Location: Local Bar / Cafe  (hopefully a new exploration every month). Venue will be our participating members choice and will be finalized one week prior to the event every month. 

* Please provide a bar/cafe recommendation in the comment section and vote yes if you agree *

Refreshments/Drinks: Buy Your Own Drink/Meal

(We appreciate sponsor pitching in on drinks/refreshments to support a great cause)

Agenda:

0. Put name tag with following initials in circle (optional, for effective networking):

a. (B) for Business Background 

b. (C) for Coding Background 

c. (S) for Statistician Background 

d. (T) for Technology Background 

e. (M) for Math / Modeling Background

1. Open networking (20min)

2. Job / Employee seekers pitch (20min)

Quick pitch (90secs each) from Job seekers or recruiters

3. Product /Project pitch session (20min)

Quick pitch (2min each) from data enthusiast who wants to share among fellow data science professionals.

4. Open networking (60min)

FAQ:

1. Can I be the event host/organizer for an evening?

Yes. We do appreciate our community members to take charge and help build a great networking event. Please make your interest known to us in comment section.

2. Can my company sponsor for the drinks/refreshments? What do they get?

Yes. Besides great karma points for helping build a strong data science community, the company will also get face time with brightest data science professionals for brand recognition. You also get an opportunity for a 90 sec pitch time about the company & job openings.

3. Will event still happen even if there are no sponsors?

Yes. As long as there is a mutually agreed bar/cafe for the evening the event is a GO. Attendees will buy their own drinks/refreshments.

4. Could we volunteer our office space for the networking?

Yes, one of the bigger objective for the event is to introduce various innovation/discussion hubs to data science community.

5. What are the possible scenarios in which event can be cancelled?

Public Holidays, Bad Weather, Lack of interest or No venue.

6. I still have questions. How can I get them answered?

Best way is to put them in comment section, so that even our members can pitch in. You are welcome to email us as well at info[at]analytics[dot]club
results.how_to_find_us: TBA
results.name: Data Analytics.Club Monthly Mixer

Join us for a fun, stimulating evening of group critique and discussion.

New members are always welcome. We'll be prepared to discuss work in any genre, prose or verse. Bring enough copies of the text you’d like to discuss for each workshop attendee to have their own. If you do not have the means to make copies, send the text by attachment to bostonpoetryunion (at) gmail (dot) com not later than the night before the workshop.

Occasionally, the moderator will invite a member or guest speaker to open the session with a brief talk on some literary topic. If you’re interested in delivering such a talk, email the organizers and let them know! We are similarly open to suggestions for writing exercises, discussions at members' homes, visits to readings or bookstores, and other events of interest to writers.

ABOUT THE WORKSHOP: Now in its 14th year, the weekly Boston Poetry workshop (formerly “Charles River Writers”) is an open, accessible, and welcoming forum for literary fellowship and discussion. Please note: In 2016, our Thursday night workshops will run in six-week blocks, in winter, spring, summer, and fall.

results.description:
Two talks for May 26 meeting:

1. (@6:30) Lucy Monahan will open with Running Parse on Azure Web Sites. The Parse Platform is a cloud app platform that was open-sourced by Facebook in January 2016. Just three months after the announcement the Parse Platform has a thriving ecosystem for mobile developers.

This short talk will show how easy it is to go from no code to having a Parse Server up and running on Azure, including a MongoDB from mLab in the backend. The demo whips up a small Android app to show data being saved all the way through to MongoDB. All in 15 minutes.

Come along to see Azure and Parse Server in action!

2. (@7:00) Michal Klos from Localytics will follow with a talk on Building a Low-latency, Real-time Parquet & Presto Data Warehouse in the Cloud emphasizing working with big data in the cloud and how to take advantage of cloud architectures.

OVERALL AGENDA (All time/topics are approximate until delivered!)

• 6:00 - Gather, grab pizza, socialize

• 6:30 - Lucy Monahan's talk (Running Parse on Azure Web Sites)

• 7:00 - Michal Klos's talk (Building a Low-latency, Real-time Parquet & Presto Data Warehouse in the Cloud)

• 8:15 - Announcements, wrap-up

• 8:30 - Sometimes we go for a cold beverage

Speaker bios:

Michal Klos leads the Data Platform team at Localytics, a mobile app analytics and marketing engagement platform. Localytics ingests terabytes of data each day from billions of devices to drive its products. Michal has been at Localytics for two years, with a career of building data analytics platforms at companies including WB Games, Compete, and Harte-Hanks.

Lucy Monahan (@SoFetching) is a Principal QE at Constant Contact and indie Android developer. At Constant Contact Lucy delights small businesses, the engine of our economy, with marketing tools to make them successful. She's a UMass Boston computer science alum and currently writing Android apps using the Parse Platform.

Event: Boston Azure May Meeting

Date:[masked]

Time: 6:00pm

Set Up: theatre

Room Location: 1MEM - 1st Sampson/Paul

Number of People: 50
results.name: Leverage Cloud Archs for Big Data/Michal Klos && Run Parse on Azure/Lucy Monahan

results.description:
History! Those who don't know it are doomed to etc.

Smalltalk is one of the earliest object-oriented languages. It's extremely influential — many of the OO concepts that we use in today's languages were first developed in Smalltalk. But what influenced Smalltalk? Alan Kay will walk us through the language's inspirations in this talk, including such crazy new technologies as UIs with overlapping windows and a 1970's-era ur-tablet!

http://worrydream.com/EarlyHistoryOfSmalltalk/

Bio:

Douglas Creager is a software engineer at Google with an eclectic history. He got a CS Master's from MIT working in a biology group, and a PhD from Oxford while teaching formal methods to professional software engineers. He's worked as a consultant helping finance and telecoms firms wrangle data between different systems, and was VP of Engineering for a network security startup based out of DC. He lives deep in the western suburbs, but realizes that “Papers We Love Worcester” doesn't have quite the same ring to it.
results.name: Douglas Creager on The Early History Of Smalltalk by Alan C. Kay

results.description:
Come paddle at one of our practice sessions with Living Root, your 2015 Boston Dragon Boat Festival Grand Champions! We're a social and friendly co-ed team who enjoy the sport of dragon boat paddling. 

Are you new to paddling? No problem! We'll show you everything you need to know to paddle on a dragon boat. This is a great way to meet people, get in shape, and do something fun in the sun.

We meet at 6pm at the docks behind the Barking Crab (88 Sleeper Street in Boston), a short walk from South Station.  We paddle rain or shine, so dress for the weather.  Wear comfortable workout clothing and footwear that you don't mind getting wet. Bring a bottle of water, and we'll provide all the paddling equipment you'll need and a place to lock up your belongings.  We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice. So come join us!  Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked]. 

Additional Location and Parking information can be found here

Check out our website or find us on Facebook!

results.description:
Walkers & Joggers Welcome

May 3, 2016 @ 6:15PM (every Tuesday and Thursday night for 9 wks)

We're here to help you achieve your goal of beginning to run your first 5K. Too many people have been turned off of running simply by trying to start off too fast. Their bodies rebel, and they wind up miserable, wondering why anyone would possibly want to run in the first place. You should ease into your 5K training plan gradually. In fact, the beginners' program we outline here is less of a running regimen than a walking and jogging program. The idea is to transform you from couch potato to runner, getting you to begin running a 5K or 3.1 miles and on a regular basis in just two months.  Each session should take about 20 or 30 minutes, three times a week. That just happens to be the same amount of moderate exercise recommended by numerous studies for optimum fitness. This program will get you fit. 

We will be meeting twice a week, so you SHOULD train the 3rd time on your own either on Saturday or Sunday to keep with the schedule.  Remember to bring your sneakers and some water.
  http://www.coolrunning.com/engine/2/2_3/181.shtml


Inclement Weather: Heavy rains will cancel. We will train if it is overcast or there is a slight drizzle. Please plan to bring a lightweight jacket with a hood just in case.

results.name: Couch to 5K Training! (Walkers & Joggers Welcome!)

results.description:
Are you Separated or Divorced, Considering Divorce, or Currently in the Process of Divorce? Please join us for May'sDivorce Basics Monthly Series: A Legal Overview of the Divorce Process. 

This event is intended to be partly informational, partly social, and totally empowering. It will be casual/interactive and not formal, which is a setting that attendees of these events really like. 

For the first hour...Attorney David Kellem, accomplished divorce attorney and mediator, will walk you through the basics of the divorce process. He will cover the most important issues that one faces when going through divorce or separation, including asset division, debt issues, custody, and child support & alimony. He also will address issues around the modification and enforcement of existing judgments and agreements. (For more information on David, including his bio, please click on this link: http://www.kellemlawgroup.com/the-group/davidkellem/).

The second hour will be a chance to socialize with other attendees and speak one-on-one with David as well as the other professionals. At this event, there will also be Bob Vona and Samantha Steer, Financial Advisors, to answer your questions.

There is no cost for attendance. Complimentary refreshments and snacks will be provided. Space is limited, so RSVP to reserve your spot. Please change your RSVP right away if your plans change so that someone on the waiting list can take your spot.

When: Thursday May 26th 6:30 – 8:30 p.m. & Saturday May 28th 10 a.m. to noon. Both dates are the same event (Meetups listed separately). Choose the time and date convenient for you.

Similar Divorce Basics Monthly Series events will be held at this location on the fourth Thursday and fourth Saturday of every month. Please check the calendar for these upcoming events:

• Thursday, June 23 & Saturday, June 25, 2016. The House -- Should you try to keep it or sell it; what to consider.

• Thursday, July 21 & Saturday, July 23, 2016. Emotional Issues in Divorce; Is there such a thing as emotional justice?

• Thursday, August 25 & Saturday, August 27, 2016. Retirement and Financial Planning for Divorce and Separation.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the stairs or the elevator from the lobby to the 1st floor where the event will be held. Call or text Deanna at 508-333-3191 with any questions or for directions.
results.name: Divorce Basics: A Legal Overview of the Divorce Process

results.description:
Every Thursday evening at 6:30 PM we gather as a group for a nice nighttime "romp" at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. It's a great way to wind down a busy work day, to catch up with Bulldogs friends, or to meet new people!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 am and Thursday evenings at 6:30 pm. We will first gather in front of the Starbucks in Cleveland Circle, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there! 

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

• Website - BostonBulldogsRunning.com

• Email - [masked] 

• Phone -[masked]

results.description:
Confronting Systemic Racism: (Meeting five consecutive Thursdays , plus a bonus event) 6:30 -8:30 pm, May 26th - June 30th.

These evening workshop style courses will engage participants in designing action plans while immersing them in resources that analyze systemic racism and the ways that we can be actors in dismantling it. The course will move participants beyond learning about racial injustice and examining white supremacy and provide ways to launch into action. The course will also provide them with ways to craft support systems that will work for them and processes that will keep their work sustainable and effective. 

$70 fee associated with all 5 events in this series with need based scholarships available upon request.

results.description:
We will be having our May meetup at the Cisco office with food and beverages sponsored by Cumulus Networks.  Clay Haynes from Nexum, Inc will be speaking on EVPN!


---

As more and more enterprises begin to develop multiple datacenter deployments for their enterprises, new technologies have come along to solve many common problems with basic network connectivity between datacenters. This presentation describes Ethernet VPN, a new and open standard to forward Layer-2 information between Layer-3 segments. This presentation will describe and demonstrate Ethernet VPN deployments via MPLS extensions as well as integrating with VXLAN deployments for virtualized infrastructures.

Clay is a Senior Network Engineer at Nexum, Inc. He has 10+ years of experience in server, networking, and security environments. Clay has earned the prestigious JNCIE-ENT and JNCIE-SEC certifications, and has been a big proponent in datacenter interconnect technology.
results.name: EVPN: Or how I learned to stop worrying and love the BGP

results.description:
Please RSVP! (E51-335  - 70 Memorial Dr. Cambridge, MA - map and parking info at bottom of announcement.

How Intermarket Analysis Helps Make the Bull vs. Bear Case

By Boston Investors Group Member Samantha LaDuc

Both active traders and investors can use Intermarket Analysis to stay on the right side of a trade.

It helps to have a framework—both a big picture strategy as well as a tactical plan. Samantha will share her approach:

Intermarket Analysis for direction, velocity and duration:

a.  Asset Breadth as a Tell

b.  Outliers with Velocity Revert

a.  There’s a Bull Market Somewhere  

LaDucTrading:

a.  Timeframe: How to find low-risk entries with defined stops and profit targets, based on timeframe congruence.

b.  Methodology: How to Forecast or Chase while managing risk.

c.  Position Size: Or How to Preserve Both Emotional and Financial Capital.

BIO:  Samantha LaDuc, founder of LaDuc Trading LLC, is a strategic technical analyst, teacher and trader. She grew a small technology company (family of 60) for 10 years before selling it. Actively trading since 2008, Samantha specializes in outliers with velocity–on any timeframe. With a chart pattern and volatility focus, she advises day traders through asset managers. Her mentoring helps clients “fill in the gaps” between guessing and knowing when to enter and exit an options or equity trade. Since process and performance matter, she details both on her website: www.laductrading.com.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MIT Building E51  is located at 70 Memorial Dr, but the entrance is at 2 Amherst St (put that in your GPS).   The best parking is in the "elbow" of Building E51, and there is also good parking at the Hayward St lot, about a block West.

Here is a map link: http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=E51

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you! Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room. We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone. This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
results.name: Boston Investor's Group Meetup

Hosted by Chloé Cunha and Rob Crean, featuring Mathieu Cunha as the Intern and Wes Hazard as the Questionable Expert, and withstanding Jade Sylvan/Jack van Sly as our Fact Checker from the Institute of Human Knowledge and Hygiene. Musical support provided by the Michael J. Epstein Memorial Library.

The Encyclopedia Show Somerville is an event franchised from the original series founded in Chicago in 2008, wherein invited artists from a variety of performance disciplines present all-new, original works on sub-topics of a single theme. A recurring cast of hosts and characters welcomes the artists with open arms and minds, while the resident Fact Checker is charged with maintaining the integrity of the Encyclopedic Truth of the show.

As always, we are located at The Davis Square Theater in the eponymous Square, 255 Elm St. (same door as Saloon). For directions: http://bostonpoetryslam.com/encyclopediashow/directions-to-the-encyclopedia-show

Produced by Catherine Martin and the Boston Poetry Slam.

This is an all ages show! (Suggested 14+ for strong language and vague sexuality.)
$10 admission / $7 for students and teachers.

results.description:
About the talk:


Django and JavaScript.  Django brings good abstractions and automation to server side code; in this talk, we'll go through how to get the same power in your web frontend with Angular.js.  We'll cover how to use dynamic page elements, frontend form validation, and AJAX in the context of a Django app, as well as ways of passing data between Django and Angular.  We'll also preview a new library called Silica being developed to automate large parts of Django-Angular integration, including adding Angular support to Django's form library.

About the Speaker:
Benjamin "Zags" Zagorsky is the CTO of Zagaran Software Consulting, where he leads numerous full-stack custom development projects.

Sponsors:

Space and pizza provided by Akamai.
results.name: Benjamin "Zags" Zagorsky: Django and JavaScript with Angular.js

results.description:
Cambridge meetup is back! We are going to have this event every other week!


http://www.championscambridge.com/


As usual, please bring your driver's license or passport, if you would like to have alcohol. They are strict about IDs, No IDs no booze.  But people under 21 are welcome as well to this event  - Champions is almost as much a restaurant as a bar and you need not order a drink.


You are responsible for your own consumption and please start and settle your own tab. Please bring your Credit/Debit card or cash and start your tab with the waiter.    Please be sure to tip - we suggest 20% as it is a lot of extra trouble for them to do separate tabs, but it saves us work and allows people to leave at different times.  But first be sure that the tip is not included already - it usually is not but occasionally is, at 18%, if there is a large group, in which case you need not tip additional.  (If you know the price of what you ordered, and add 7% MA meals tax, and that is the total, they have NOT added in the tip.)

RSVP required. Please sign up. If you RSVP "Yes," but your plans change, please change your RSVP to "No" so others can sign up. Deadline for reservation is 3PM as we need to get an accurate head count for the reservation. On nights when we are expecting many people, we limit the RSVP number to 27. However, if you'd like to attend, but can't RSVP, send a message to an organizer, as we may be able to get you in.


Champions is located at MIT/Kendall Sq. station. If you come from Boston side, you will see right in front of the T exit. It is part of the Marriott. Even though the address is listed as 50 Broadway, you can really only see it from the Main street side.  We are usually either in the separate room toward the Marriott lobby, or else at two long central tables in the room to the right of the host station.
results.how_to_find_us: We usually make a reservation. Please RSVP by 3pm on the day of the event. Ask hostess for Japanese/English Meetup group.
results.name: Talk over drinks in Kendall Sq. Cambridge

results.description:
Yoga is a unique mixture of spirituality and exercise, Eastern philosophy and Western popularity that meshes beautifuly with photography. Whether you’re in a gym or on a mountaintop,the way people contort their bodies during yoga creates the beauty and lines that can lead to some great photos.

The RiversEdge Photographic Society is looking for 4 female models to participate in our yoga themed photo shoot. If you can hold some great poses this is a great chance to get portfolio-quality images created in a professional studio.
We are casting for a MUA, but please come prepared to do your own hair and make-up, in case there is a problem.

If you would like to model for this shoot, please respond via email, that includes a phone number, ASAP to [masked] so I can put you on our list. We will finalize our cast for the shoot about 7 days before the shoot date.

The shoot will be held at Studio Imaging 637 (http://StudioImaging637.com/), on Thursday evening, May 26th. Models should arrive by 6:30 pm to begin makeup and the shoot will last until 10pm. Models must be at least 18 years old and will need to sign the club's model release.

There will be multiple photographers and 3-4 sets dedicated to creating professional images that demonstrate your passion. Please bring at least 2 different outfits to model. This shoot will be limited to 4 female models, so if you are interested, please respond soon so that you can be considered for the shoot.
The RiversEdge Photographic Society provides a creative and supportive community with a special focus on the art and science of people photography: portrait, glamour and fashion photography, studio lighting and related subjects. The club includes many experienced portrait photographers. This is a great opportunity to have fun, get some different new pictures for your portfolio, make contact with several excellent photographers, and learn about participating in future club events. Models will receive images from all the photographers they work with.

You can visit the club's Meet Up site at:

http://www.meetup.com/RiversEdge-Photographic-Society

Please visit our Facebook page where you can browse through pictures from our past shoots:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Rivers-Ed … 213?ref=nf

The studio is near the River St. exit off Rt 93 on the Andover/Lawrence boarder, at 637 Andover Street , Lawrence, MA (http://StudioImaging637.com/ )

results.description:
Join us to eat, drink, write, share work, trade author/book recommendations, and more!

Thursday Format:
After a round of introductions, we start out with a general, unstructured freewrite to get everyone in the writing mindset. We continue writing to a series of three or so writing prompts that usually one of the organizers has prepared before hand. Members are encouraged to share their work, or what they wrote about, for each prompt. We spend the remainder of the group working on our own separate projects, continuing work from one of the prompts, freewriting, or just chatting with each other.

When we have a piece to workshop, we often will write to two or so prompts, and then will go into a discussion of that piece. The workshop may take up the rest of the group, or may conclude with time left at the end.


Read more about workshops here.
results.how_to_find_us: We are usually sitting at the long table in the middle of Panera, near the fireplace.

* This is an online only event. Job Seeker Apply, and they'll be contacted by Recruiters if selected *

Job Seeker Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdc

Recruiter Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdr

No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!

AnalyticsWeek's Hire51 is bringing world's largest data analytics hiring drive to town. By last day of every month topdata and analytics talent applicant apply to Data Analytics Talent Drive to help us bring top data opportunities to topdata professionals.

Here's the process:

When: Each month talent run starts with first day of the month. (Data Analytics Hiring Drive resume collection stops last day of the previous month)

Where: In your own preferred city.

Process:

> For Job Seeker:

1. Applicant apply as Job Seeker at: http://math.im/dtdc

2. Anonymized candidates chosen by recruiters will be contacted via email in 3 weeks

3. Upon interview, successful drafted candidate is celebrated in #DataTalentDraft communityIf you're DRAFTED(interviewed and hired), we have some awesome swags for you.

> For Recruiter:

1. Recruiters signup using the form at: http://math.im/dtdr

2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates

3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction

Here are some things to know about Data Analytics Hiring Drive:

• It is a continuously rolling event on monthly basis

• Candidates will be contacted once their profile is shortlisted by a recruiter

• The candidate profile is kept in database for 3 months

• Candidate with 3 months and older profile are requested to refresh the profile to activate it back again

• Hire51's Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies

• We are designing an AI bot to scan your profile and go on a hunt to find the right job that suits your profile

• Every passing day we are getting smarter and connecting more profiles to right jobs

• You don't need to go anywhere to participate, just apply on the link given above & below and complete the process so our engine will start working to find right opportunity for you.

In case you missed the links above:

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Job-Seeker Signup @ http://math.im/dtdc

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Recruiter Signup @ http://math.im/dtdr

results.description:
Tickets are here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sketchhaus-tickets-19934061314


Sex! Drugs! Tornadoes! Your infinitely corruptable self is about to discover the lunacy that is Sketchhaus.


TERRIBLE PEOPLE comes off its first monthly show to bring you a greatest hits presentation of their best sexy sketches. From a bunch of idiots that laugh at their own jokes, comes the best sketch comedy in Boston! Come join Terrible People as they explore that thin line between "funny" and "regrettable" as only they can. So get some drinks in and be one of the Terrible People. "GREATEST HITS: SEX!"

ALSO: the very first TORNADOES, presented by Boston's best roving storytelling show, WILD MEMORY NATION, featuring scripted comedy monologues by some of the city's - and country's! - funniest people. Storytellers are given a single topic and then spin their hilarious tales out. "Tornadoes" is our show highlighting funny stories about serious stuff; come see Brett Woodford laugh at cancer, Josh Poirier make jokes about Parkinson's disease, and Matt Kona find the funny at funerals. Featured everywhere from The Boston Comedy Arts Festival, Johnny D's Comedy Presents, and the Women In ComedyFestival, Wild Memory Nation promises true stories, real funny.

Your host is the brilliant and hilarious Adam Abelson! Produced by the astounding Kevin Quigley. A bucket of sketch and comedy for only $12. THERE'S ALSO BEER.
results.name: Live Sketch Comedy - Only the Best at ImprovBoston's Sketchhaus ($12 - cheap!)

Note:  Pose will be the same as the Saturday 4-hour sessions, so if you want to get a REALLY long pose, sign up for both.  

Jeremy Durling will host- Jeremy's paintings are available through the Sloane Merrill Gallery on Charles Street in Boston.  

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Four hours each Friday morning, 10:00- 2:00pm. You can come individual days by paying $20 (members) or $30 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html


PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $70 or $85 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Come and have some real fun pooch play inside this great big beautiful space! We hope to meet EVERY 4th Friday! Your dog can run around and play with others, off leash, in a safe environment.  

It's FREE, thanks to the generosity of one of our sponsors, Michelle Welch's Turn Around Training. See www.TurnAroundTraining.net

Turn Around Training is located in the Norwood Commerce Center: 


http://www.mapquest.com/places/winsmith-mill-market-at-norwood-commerce-center-norwood-ma-288112720 
61 Endicott St rear of building 46 
Norwood Ma 02062 

Take the information below with you because it can be a little tricky to get to the first time you go.  Please allow a little extra time to follow signs.

Once you are on Endicott St, go to the very end and turn left. The Antique shops will be on your right and the pond will be on your left. Take a right after the antique shops and follow the signs directing you to Turn Around Training. 

They are located in the very back of all the buildings in the rear of building.  You will see a sign on a gate saying Turn Around Training. The door is just to the right of that. Walk right in! Will give you my cell phone number in case of any problems.

results.description:
{Over the next four months, we will watch, read, and practice Byron Katie's teachings, and then together we will experience Byron Katie at the Omega Institute over Memorial Day Weekend.  If you have ever been curious about how the paradigm shifting teachings of this personal growth matriarch can give you greater peace and end needless suffering, please join us on this journey ... } 

 "I discovered that when I believed my thoughts, I suffered, but that, when I didn’t believe them, I didn’t suffer .... I found that suffering is optional. I found a joy within me that has never disappeared, not for a single moment."
-- Byron Katie

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ge6vL55DgcI

To Join Us

Register for the Omega Institute program while space remains:
- - > http://www.eomega.org/workshops/loving-what-is-0#-workshop-description-block

https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=35&v=YKjahIDfalI

RSVP on this page.  As we move forward, we'll set up gatherings to work together.

About Byron Katie

For almost a decade, Byron Katie suffered from constant thoughts of suicide. Then one morning in 1986, she experienced a life-changing realization. “In that instant of no-time,” she says, “I discovered that, when I believed my thoughts, I suffered, but that when I didn’t believe them, I didn’t suffer, and that this is true for every human being.”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nn14ooi-6UQ

From this realization came The Work, an astonishingly simple process, accessible to people of all ages and backgrounds, that requires nothing more than a pen and paper, and an open mind. The Work is a way of identifying and questioning the thoughts that cause all the suffering in the world. As Katie guides you with her humor and lovingly incisive clarity, you will find that your stressful beliefs begin to radically shift.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=x4_iejhT6AA


The Work

The Work helps us to identify and question the stressful thoughts that cause us suffering.  Inquiry consists of four simple questions and a "turnaround".  A turnaround is a way to experience the opposite of the belief that gives us pain.  Through doing The Work, we question thoughts that we have believed for years. 

The Work is a simple, deep process which can transform our lives in unimaginable ways.  We may experience increased clarity, peace, and energy, richer, deeper relationships, and less anger and stress.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DwHujZI4aGQ


Why Join PGN at Omega for Byron Katie?

Spend this Spring exploring which parts of Byron Katie's work is most applicable to you.

Experience the freedom of undoing whatever makes you unhappy, and allow your mind to return to its true, awakened, peaceful, creative nature.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sBCi7qeFkhw

Reading: The Work

PDF of short version of The Work.

Judge Your Neighbor Worksheet

Fill out a Judge Your Neighbor Worksheet and then taking the stressful thoughts to Inquiry.   You can start the process right now. Click here to print out your own Judge Your Neighbor worksheet to try out before you come.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vqjj7nvqczo&feature=player_embedded
results.name: Byron Katie: Loving What Is

results.description:
Kick off Memorial Day weekend with us on Friday 5/27 for an epic party at American Fresh Brewhouse + Taproom by Somerville Brewing (The makers of Slumbrew!) Folks have been asking for four years for Happy Sol in beach worthy cans so and they're finally making it happen. We'll be celebrating their can release of a bunch of tasty beers, raffling away awesome prizes and eating some delicious food specials. Come drink some of the freshest beer in a cool warehouse urban brewery. 

Try the newly released Lobstah Killah, a hoppy imperial red ale that takes no prisoners! This unique beer style goes great with Slumbrew's lobster mac & cheese special! 

 
If you haven't tried the Happy Sol, you will need to get a taste of this. A light wheat body that is brewed with a ton of blood orange makes this an incredibly tasty warm weather beer, perfect for the beach! 

 
Sip on the Porter for Paradise, this cocoa nib brewed porter is then infused with toasted coconut making a decadently sweet and tasty beer. Its like dessert in a glass! 

 
Get there by 6PM for the one brewery tour of the night. Learn what goes into making Slumbrew beer and what they are planning next! 

 
So invite your friends to a great party have some beer samples. We'll be raffling away SIX FREE SWAG-FILLED COOLERS at 8PM so make sure you RSVP soon! Free to attend, pay as you eat and drink!
results.name: Slumbrew Can Release Party! Happy Sol Blood Orange & Lobstah Killah Imperial Red

results.description:
This place has all of the toyz, and there is a cost to that! You do get what you pay for though. We will start it up with mini golf, teams of four. Then bumper boats, which is a lot of fun. Tiki is right down the road, so S.O.S. will be in high gear!

http://360interactivewebtour.com/360/KimballFarm/flash/Kimball%20Farm_Kimball.html


Famous since 1939 for legendary ice cream, Kimball Farm has grown at a memorable rate. The farmhouse in Westford that is now the ice cream stand began as a dairy barn in 1908. At that time the Kimball family sold milk wholesale. In 1934 John (Jack) Allen Kimball and his wife Clara considered processing the milk and selling it house to house. This idea never came to be. As fate would have it, around this same time, two salesmen stopped by. One was selling his freezer cabinets, the other his ice cream mix. They suggested the Kimballs make ice cream. Jack and Clara took a leap of faith and in 1939 turned the woodshed on the end of the house into an ice cream parlor.

Over the years, Kimball Farm ice cream became more popular and the family made a name for themselves. Jack eventually decided to eliminate the dairy aspect of the farm and in order to focus on ice cream. In 1975, Jack and Clara moved the ice cream operation into the barn where it remains today,
becoming the first location of the famous Kimball Farm Ice Cream. Jack ran the business and his three children worked in the ice cream stand. The original flavors included maple walnut, frozen pudding and peppermint stick. In the beginning, a quart of ice cream sold for seventy cents, a cone for five cents and banana splits for twenty-five cents.

In 1988, the business was passed down to Jack’s grandsons, Michael and Peter Kimball, who run the business today. Since taking charge, they have expanded the business, adding three more locations. In 1989 Kimball Farm added an ice cream stand in Carlisle, MA. Following this came a driving range, nine hole pitch & putt golf course, adventure style mini-golf & a 6000 sq. ft. bumper boat pond along with an outdoor luncheon grill & seafood shack, all at the original Westford, MA, location.


In 1995, the family acquired a new site in Jaffrey, NH. The restaurant, ice cream stand and country store are popular with visitors from near and far. Kimball Farm in Jaffrey is on the site of Silver Ranch and receives deliveries of fresh ice cream several times a week.

In 2010 the Olde Sawmill Arcade and Grand Slam Batting cages were added to the Westford location; at the same time, the family opened the latest Kimball Farm location in Lancaster, MA featuring the same great ice cream, Outdoor Grill & Seafood Shack and Country Store.
