results.description:
Playing out like a feature-length "Twilight Zone" episode, director John Frankenheimer's "Seconds" is a thriller that deals with the topic of trying to beat death. A wealthy man (Rock Hudson) pays a mysterious organization to make him young again. The surgery is a success and the man's life begins anew, but there are serious consequences for getting a second chance.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wHHhJ96646M

"Seconds" is celebrating its 50th anniversary this year. So let's check out this classic on the big screen. The movie will be playing at the Brattle Theater on May 29th at 1 PM. I plan to be outside the theater 15 - 20 minutes before the show starts. Once the group is assembled, we can get snacks and seats.

If you have never been to the Brattle before, here are the directions by car and public transportation: 

http://www.brattlefilm.org/about-2/directions-parking/

See you then!
results.name: Seconds (1966)

results.description:
Welcome to the Cash Game Peregrine, where the blinds are .25/.50 and the game is dealer's choice or no limit holdem. There is no minimum buyin and the max is 200 bb ($100.) There is no rake, tipping, donation, or seat fee. House rules are posted below:

If it's your first time at one of my games RSVP on meetup then text, email, or call to confirm your RSVP and receive the address. If you RSVP and no-show without changing your RSVP, then you have likely taken a seat from someone else, made me very sad, and I put your name on the shit list. Don't do it. If you're running late I appreciate hearing from you.  Doors open at 6:35, and if you haven't arrived or contacted me about running late by 7:00, I will begin offering seats to the waitlist.  I reserve the right to cancel the game if we can't get enough players.

-1 chip=call

-Players must protect their hands at all times. If your hand is unintentionally mucked because you didn't protect it, there is no recourse, and the hand is dead. No exceptions.


-Verbally declared actions are binding. Tapping the table is considered a check. An unintentional action will be forgiven only once/night. Rules must be enforced fairly with all players, regardless of experience level. No exceptions.


-No string bets or splashed pots.

-Don't discuss hands as they are ongoing. Talking about hands or action is allowed only are when heads up, and only by the 2 players remaining in the pot.

-Hands must remain on table or not more than 12 inches from the edge of the table and must be visible to all players.

-Everyone makes mistakes but strive to pay attention so you act in turn in a timely fashion. If you have trouble knowing when it's your turn, let me know, and I'll help you with a reminder.


-If you are in a hand or on the button (dealing), you are not allowed to be on your phone. 

-Host's decisions on rulings are final.


-Once a player is done dealing, s/he must move the button to the next dealer.


-Cut-off shuffles, then passes the shuffled deck to the small blind to be ready for next deal.


-Rule violations that influence the course of a hand will be dealt with as follows: First time=warning, Second time=dealt out for next hand. Third time=dealt out for a round. Again, everyone makes mistakes, but an awareness of the game is important. If you have questions about proper poker etiquette, you are always welcome to ask.
results.name: .25/.50 Cash Game Peregrine (Sunday)

results.description:
This is new exhibition at the Peabody Essex Museum that should make for  a good meetup.  We'll either discuss as we look together or have a discussion over tea afterwards.  Directions and admission cost HERE.


Whether working in plaster, marble or bronze on an intimate or monumental scale, Auguste Rodin captured the emotional and psychological complexities of human beings in ways that few sculptors before or after him have achieved. He also profoundly changed the language of sculpture by playing with accident and emphasizing the act of creating rather than completing a work of art. Rodin favored fragmentation and recombination as the principal expression of the significance he attached to change and transformation as the keys to creativity. Featuring sculptures and drawings, this thematic exhibition highlights the drama and experimentation that have established Rodin as one of the greatest sculptors of all time.

Originally titled Metamorphoses: In Rodin's Studio, the exhibition is organized by the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts, in collaboration with the Musée Rodin, Paris. The exhibition was curated by Nathalie Bondil, Director and Chief curator of the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts, with the assistance of Sylvain Cordier, Associate Curator and Curator of early decorative arts, and under the direction of Catherine Chevillot, Head Curator and Director of the Musée Rodin, by Sophie Biass-Fabiani, Curator of the Graphic Arts and Painting. The AMG Foundation sponsored the exhibition at the Peabody Essex Museum. Carolyn and Peter S. Lynch and The Lynch Foundation provided generous support. The East India Marine Associates of the Peabody Essex Museum also provided support. The exhibition catalogue, with contributions on Rodin's process by leading scholars, is published by the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the cafe 5th row from entry
results.name: Rodin - Transforming Sculpure at the PEM & Discussion

results.description:
50th Anniversary!

(1966) dir Ingmar Bergman w/Bibi Andersson, Liv Ullmann [85 min; Digital]
PERSONA is arguably Ingmar Bergman’s most challenging and rewarding film. An actress who has lost her voice (Ullmann) retreats to a remote summer house to recuperate with the young nurse assigned to care for her (Andersson). While isolated, the two women’s identities begin to mesh and soon it becomes difficult to know where one ends and the other begins. A fascinating character study and a masterful art film puzzle.

Forecast for Memorial Day Sunday is rain followed by thunderstorms, highs in the mid-80's.  Don't take it personally, but spending the afternoon in the Brattle might be the best option.

See you at the movie,

John

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Potbelly Sandwich Shop behind CVS (on Somerville Ave) 

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. You can easily spot Potbelly Sandwich Shop on side entrance when you arrive at top of escalator at Porter Square Station. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

Would you like to help organize meetups for the Knapsack group?  Here's a great opportunity to get involved and help set the schedule for the summer.  Bring your plan for a meetup and we'll work with you to make it happen!  If you're bringing a plan, please include a full description for posting, some options for dates, and what you need for support.


People who attend would be eligible to become organizers.  You will learn more about the expectations for organizers when you come.

Note: if you have not met the requirement of attending three or more of our discussion meetups in the six months prior to this meetup, including one Accountability Session, you are welcome to add your ideas for meetups or the Community Meeting in the comments area, or share with an organizer.  We hope you will attend more things in the coming months!

Accessibility Information: Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The fourth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

Note: We welcome intrepid winter bike riders, though there are not many good spots for parking bikes, and bicycles are prohibited in the building.  We apologize for the inconvenience.
results.name: Planning summer meetups

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.

results.description:
Inspired by the Polyglot Club Paris weekly Polyglot meeting, Polyglot Club New England is a platform where where polyglots, linguists, language lovers, travelers and expats meet and enjoy speaking in different languages.

Love languages? Yes we do! Many have expressed that they have been looking for a group like this. Come help create a vibrant language learning community in our area!


You can practice any languages you have in common with other attendees, or share your experience learning languages so that others may benefit.


Parking: Resident parking restriction does not apply in Cambridge on Sunday and meters are free, but it can still be tough to find in the immediate area.  If all else fails and you are willing to walk some, there is usually parking on Fulkerson Street near the Kendall Square Cinema (free meters) a few blocks away.


Note: Please be sure to RSVP if you are coming, and cancel your RSVP if you can't make it.   The locale is right across from the Kendall Square T.
results.how_to_find_us: We are usually in the main area when you enter. If the group is big, we might be in the back of the place.

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 5/29  6:30

results.description:
Join the Fresh Pond Walking Community for our regular Sunday walk around Fresh Pond.   

Let's join regular walkers from surrounding towns + members of five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 5/29  6:30

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Monday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description: Today is not a washout after all, so I'm taking a sail around the outer Harbor Islands. Vessel is a Cal 33, a roomy cruiser with seating inside and out, a head and a stovetop. Exact route and return time will be dependent on wind and weather. Get on the waitlist now, and I'll set up final crew around 11 AM, with preference given to new members or people who haven't been out on the water in a while.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Starbucks at 30 Rowes Wharf
results.name: Cruise today, once the rain stops

results.description:
An RSVP only indicates your interest in the sail!

While an RSVP is necessary for me to track your interest, it does not guarantee a spot on the boat. I will send you an email to confirm your spot on the boat. This will be an e-mail directly from me, please do not be confused by system generated e-mails confirming your spot! Describing your sailing experience in detail when prompted during the RSVP process will increase your chances of being selected.


Start time may change based on forecast. 

I'll send out a final confirmation Monday morning.

To expect

Moderate to strong winds. You may get splashed and will be asked to hike out w/o the benefit of rails or hiking straps.  I like to sail fast so be prepared to frequently trim the sails and adjust boat balance. Some sailing experience is strongly preferred. I need at least 1 person able to steer w/o supervision. This will be a 3 to 4 hour sail with no pit stops on a boat without a head or engine.  You should not be susceptible to seasickness under moderate conditions or bring appropriate medication.

Where we'll sail

To be decided based on conditions.

What we will sail on
Sonar (http://piersparksailing.org/aboutus/our-fleet-and-equipment). This is a 23 foot racer/daysailer with no head, cabin or engine.

To bring
There is plenty of dry storage so bring extra layers, food, water, and medicine if you get sea sick. PFDs will be provided.

Important Disclaimer

Sailing with me may be stressful at times. It is unlikely but is possible to sustain an injury during sailing. I will try to ensure that we have a safe sailing adventure but be advised that getting scratched or hurt occasionally is considered part of the sport.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet by the head of the ramp down to the dock
results.name: Sailing a Sonar in Boston Harbor.

results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Asian girl wearing purple 5.10

results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4

results.description:
***PLEASE ADD YOUR TOPIC SUGGESTIONS TO THE COMMENT SECTION OR MESSAGE AN ORGANIZER***

This will be the May session of our ongoing Current Events meetup series (**NO prior attendance required). We aim to have reoccurring discussions moving forward in an effort to stay abreast of local, national, and global anti-racism issues together as a community. We have seen a surge in media coverage within the racial justice movement over the past year. It can get overwhelming trying to keep up with all the stories, events, anniversaries, policies, and debates that touch on racial justice in some way. Let's pool our collective knowledge and discuss what's going on - locally, nationally, and globally - within the realm of anti-racism. This will be a great opportunity to share our sources, our stories, and our knowledge to keep everyone informed of the way things are changing, and unfortunately, the many ways in which things are staying the same.

The topics will change from month to month depending upon what's happening in the world, but many stories may carry over. Considering a current event you'd like to discuss at the meeting? Have a helpful article you'd like to share? Want to look at a story from an unexplored angle? Know of a local story/action/event that may not be getting coverage? Great! Feel free to post in the comments section below or email one of the facilitators with your ideas. We hope you'll come to this session willing to share your thoughts and knowledge on the events of the past month. If not, feel free to listen, learn, and participate in some really important conversations. Looking forward to seeing you all there and continuing this discussion series! 

Review from past months:

- 2016 Presidential Race

- Scalia's Death

- Entertainment: Beyonce's halftime show, OscarsSoWhite, Cam Newton

- Boston Latin Schools battle racism

- Flint Water Crisis

- Boston Police Body Cameras

New intermediate kizomba 8 week program starts this Monday April 25th! You should know the basics already to attend this program, otherwise join our Wednesdays beginners class at 7pm.


SIGN UP in advance and SAVE $20!! OF 8 WEEK PROGAM HERE * online at http://movesandvibes.com/schedule/

If you are brand new to Kizomba then this is the time to get started. if you're not too sure about it then this is the time to find out for yourself. If you've been to a few classes then this is what you've been waiting for. Come find out why everyone is so excited.

- Professionally developed Kizomba instruction program created by world renowned dancer Manuel 'Dr Kizomba' Dos Santos.
- A series of classes that will follow a progression from week 1 till 8, covering the timing, rhythm and accent of the dance
- Exciting features include learning the unique connection, body motion and dips of Kizomba!
- Being a program as opposed to a 'drop in' class we will be able to progress together through the weeks, mastering the feeling and art of Kizomba
- Most of all its going to be filled with fun, excitement, jokes and smiles! lets do this

* Find out more info and buy your pass to the 8 week program online at http://movesandvibes.com/schedule/
* Alternatively, contact Inna Dançarina to pay in person.

This program is only $100 for 8 classes, making it one of the most affordable dance programs anywhere. And you can save $20 on top o that if you sign up in advance!

Its about inclusiveness not exclusiveness, we cant wait to share this beautiful art with you!!

Moves and Vibes team!

Please join Roger Leary, organizer of the South Shore Hike & Bike Meetup Group (among many others) on an info session regarding his upcoming Costa Rica group trips. Current trip to be discussed will be the November 26 to December 3 trip to Nosara and Playa Guiones, but feel free to come if you are contemplating another week and we can answer any questions you would like about Costa Rica travel.

If you would like a brochure on this trip, please send me a private message with your email.

If you have already attended the presentation and are ready to book, here is the information we send out in an email:

"Hello Costa Rica Travelers! Thank you for attending our Costa Rica Vacation Package presentation. Over the past week, the focus has been on Roger’s Adventure Package, which is for November 26 through December 3, 2016. I have attached the brochure on the basic package. After booking with us and reserving your spot in the house you can then add in as many activities as you would like, the majority of which which range in price from $15 to $125 per activity if it is near the beach. Volcanoes are not near the beach, but you can add a full-day trip in if you would like. I will forward another email to you with a list to select from. For the time being, however, please reserve your spot in the house and your flight by doing the following:

Please confirm receipt of this email by replying, "received".

Some of the benefits of The Surround include: - Building unconditional connections and friendships.- Exploring the key aspects of being a man in a mature and open conversation.- Creating and supporting one another in fulfilling our intentions.- Improving relationships in all areas of life.- Changing old behaviors and beliefs that limit life.- Learning what we were not taught growing up.- Enjoying a safe, open, and honest space.

NEW PROTOCOL FOR SIGN UP:  PLEASE RSVP HERE FOR FREE, AND EITHER PAY ONLINE AT 

http://bostonfigurecenter.org/credit-card-payment/

OR BRING THE MONEY WITH YOU CHECK OR CASH...


Come draw some dynamic poses with us at Damon's studio- we do shorter poses here, 5 minutes to start, and ranging through 10, 20, and 30 minute poses.  Informal setting in Damon's painting studio, surrounded by his paintings and work in progress.

You can pay online in advance when you RSVP, and save time for drawing during the session.  Please customize the amount you're paying online according to whether you've paid your membership this month or not ($15 for members, $25 for a one-time drop in- which can be converted to a membership should you come back that same month). You may also pay your $25 monthly membership when that comes due each month online either together with the payment for the drawing session or separately through the link to the left on the sidebar.

Parking is on-street legally for two hours for people without Somerville parking permits, BUT WE PREFER THAT YOU PARK IN THE LOT AROUND BACK, WHICH IS OPEN till about 11PM.  The building is a working factory, so the lot is monitored and safe, though it is a bit of a walk around the building to the front door.   Please do not leave your car in the lot past 11pm or so, or on Saturdays past three pm, as they lock the gate if there is not late shift and your car will be locked in until the next shift starts at the factory.

results.description: We are so deeply identified with the various thoughts and feelings that arise in our mind that we can often feel stuck in our mental habits. Through understanding the true nature of our mind explained by Buddha, we can come to relate to our thoughts and feelings as like waves of the ocean of our mind, and through letting the waves of thought dissolve and settle, we will discover our mind’s natural capacity for vast clarity and peace. Meditating in this way helps us develop a new powerful self-identification based upon our mind’s limitless potential that is the perfect foundation to be able to make the positive inner transformation we wish to. http://www.meditationinmass.org/somerville/

results.description:
Ever want to go an an adventure to the beautiful beaches and lush rain forests of Costa Rica? Well, here is your opportunity. We're planning an amazing trip with 5 different levels of accommodations and an amazing array of adventures at your fingertips, at the most very affordable price. 


Right now the projected dates for our group are November 26th to December 3rd, but other dates are available . Currently we are adding additional dates in Feb. School vacation week and probably the week after. (I might be going in July as well. But Stacey goes down often.)  Just come for general info now and you can figure out which dates are best for you later. 

Each has it's pros and cons. It all depends on what you're looking for. But all are amazingly fun and you'll never forget this adventure. Guarantee it!!!!

And one thing you get on these that you won't get from any online booking site - and this is the best part: a meetup organizer that has experience in the area to show you a good time. It's like having your own local tour guide--because you do!!!!

UPDATE - OPTION 4 IS WHAT WE ARE RESERVING FOR OUR GROUP TRIP FROM NOV 26TH - DEC 3RD. THE HOUSES AREN'T GUARANTEED UNTIL WE GET ENOUGH DEPOSITS TO MAKE A PRETTY HEFTY DOWN PAYMENT. BUT REST ASSURED. THEY'RE ALL PRETTY DAMN NICE. 


.......................................


Please look at our 5 options below:

Option 1 - Surf Hostel 

Don't let the name fool you. This is Raw Costa Rican beauty at its best. Delicious food, gracious hosts, RIGHT on the black sand beach of rural of the Central American Coast.


(That was me enjoying my morning tea at the hostel last December)

Rustic yet clean and comfortable, and right on the beach.


The food is amazing and the staff is super accommodating and sweet. Still close to all the attractions and adventures. The door to this room is about 25 feet from where I had my tea in the top photo. Gorgeous!


...................................................................................................


Option 2 - OstionalTurtle Lodge. 

A step up. very clean upgraded accommodations in Ostional.  Very clean with AC and private baths.


...........................................................................

Option 3 - Azul Ocean Club 5 Star resort


 A luxury resort not far from these places and all the attractions with high end restaurants and accommodations. It's a 5 star, well-manicured resort close to all the activities and other venues so we can still play together.


...........................................................................

Option 4 - Surf House in Nosara

Nosara is a coastal surf community full of restaurants, night life, gorgeous beaches, and Costa Rican activities such as surfing, zip lining, yoga, horseback riding and a whole lot more. The advantage to this gem is that you're right in the middle of all the action. You will be able to walk to many of the activities you're looking for. This house is not a definite. It depends on how many people sign up and how quickly, which is why I am eager to get this ball rolling. The quicker you guys sign up and pay, the more likely it is that we land a nice house like this near the water.


..............................................................................


Option 5 - Adults Only 

All Inclusive Occidental Grand Papagayo Resort

Closer to the airport, this all inclusive offers one stop shopping for those who want a short commute from the airport and a more relaxing time away. Costa Rican adventures are still a step away, but this is for those of you who are looking for a less active and more "polished" vacation. 

..............................................................................

ACTIVITIES

In addition to these resorts are our activities. Some will be included depending on your package. All can be added.


Sunset horseback ride on the beach


Yoga with a view


Stand Up Paddleboarding....or sitting. Either way, the view is amazing...


Surfing Lessons 


View the wildlife.... Ever want to moon your friends in a rainforest waterfall?


Or Ziplining
results.name: Costa Rican Adventure Info Session QUINCY Edition

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Do you want to learn about or improve your sand doubles game?  Transition your indoor skills to the beach?  Improve consistency of your game in the sand?  Join us every Tue!  This is our 3rd season ;]  No charge (free).

Level - Middle intermediates (currently playing volleyball regularly, understand and follows basic rules, able to execute basic pass, set and hit skills, and has good fitness).

5:45 to 6:30 – Review beach strategies and skill building drills

6:00-7:30 – Play beach/sand doubles on a men's height net 

I am looking forward to sharing many of the skills and strategies I have learned from clinics that I have taken.  Please bring your strategy and skill building ideas as well.  If you have a good quality beach ball, please bring it.  More balls = more hits.

Reminder to bring water, sunglasses, bug spray and a beach chair.

ATTENDEES and RSVPs

The way the Meetup system works, you have to register for each week.  You can register 3 weeks in advance.

We are trying to build a group of people who attend regularly or semi-regularly.  The coaching is organized to build on previous weeks, so it is preferable to have some regular players each week. 

In order to encourage that, when confirming the RSVPs, I will give preference to participants who have attended previously.

Again, I am doing this to encourage a regular group of people.  I regret any frustration that this may cause if your RSVP status is changed.

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

It's letter and number tile night! Do you have games that we can have fun with? Bring them tonight!

Come join the C&C crew over for a night of Letter Tile Games. Bring Banana Grams, Scrabble, Boggle, Upwords, Appleletters and any other letter game and let the fun begin.  

We'll also be playing number tiles too like Rummikub and Dominos.

Although we start around 6:00pm or so, early birds (before 6pm) can take advantage of their half-price happy hour menu. These are full-portion sized appetizers for real cheap! If not, you'll still be able to take advantage of the monthly specials.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

See you there!!

South Boston, MA @ Joe Moakley Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th)

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th)

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Tuesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 10th)

League Format:

Our first week will be a tennis jamboree open to everyone, weeks 2-6 will be round-robin team competition, week 7 will be an individual tournament unless utilized for rained-out match makeups.

Registration Details:

Registration for the league is through the Teamsnap mobile app or Teamsnap.com. Teamsnap is an easy-to-use social sports league application that:

1. Helps you save time communicating with your team on your phone 2. Provides you auto-notifications on schedule updates, changes and cancellations.  3. Allows you to send messages, send updates, track matches, share photos and more. Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League smartphone users are encouraged to download the Teamsnap application on their mobile devices.

USE THE LINK BELOW TO SIGN UP FOR TEAMSNAP AND REGISTER FOR THIS SPRING SEASON OF THE JACK’S ABBY SOCIAL TENNIS LEAGUE: https://go.teamsnap.com/divisions/72836/registration/24517/register/new

Don’t forget our referral program – We discount your registration fee $10.00 for every player who joins the league off your recommendation!

Thanks everyone – I look forward to seeing you on court this spring!

Christo

results.description:
Walkers & Joggers Welcome

May 3, 2016 @ 6:15PM (every Tuesday and Thursday night for 9 wks)

We're here to help you achieve your goal of beginning to run your first 5K. Too many people have been turned off of running simply by trying to start off too fast. Their bodies rebel, and they wind up miserable, wondering why anyone would possibly want to run in the first place. You should ease into your 5K training plan gradually. In fact, the beginners' program we outline here is less of a running regimen than a walking and jogging program. The idea is to transform you from couch potato to runner, getting you to begin running a 5K or 3.1 miles and on a regular basis in just two months.  Each session should take about 20 or 30 minutes, three times a week. That just happens to be the same amount of moderate exercise recommended by numerous studies for optimum fitness. This program will get you fit. 

We will be meeting twice a week, so you SHOULD train the 3rd time on your own either on Saturday or Sunday to keep with the schedule.  Remember to bring your sneakers and some water.
  http://www.coolrunning.com/engine/2/2_3/181.shtml


Inclement Weather: Heavy rains will cancel. We will train if it is overcast or there is a slight drizzle. Please plan to bring a lightweight jacket with a hood just in case.

results.description:
May will be a special month at Boston Golang! We've got William Kennedy, author of Go in Action and well-travelled conference speaker, stopping by for the evening.

We'll also have a special announcement to make during this meeting so join your fellow Gophers for a great event.


Go delivers on performance and productivity - William Kennedy

Why are so many companies switching to Go? One reason is because performance matters and Go delivers on performance. But performance is not enough, if it was everyone would write code in C. The real reason is because productivity matters and Go delivers on productivity. How has Go been designed to make programmers productive and at the same time write performant code? How does Go bring performance and productivity together in a programming language everyone can use. That is what we will explore in this talk.

Note: Be sure to bring your copy of "Go in Action" so you can ask Bill to sign it!

William Kennedy is a managing partner at Ardan Studios in Miami, FL, a mobile, web and systems development company. He is also a co-author of the book Go In Action, the author of the blog GoingGo.Net and the organizer for the Go meetup in Miami. Bill is focused on Go education and through his new venture Ardan Labs, working with individuals and groups who want to take their Go knowledge and coding skills to the next level.

results.description:
Numerology - Life Path, Core Numbers

Quadruple Advanced Numerologist Certified.

The study of Numerology is exciting and brings insight into our own subconscious mind. It certainly is informative and can shed light on many of those unknown and elusive qualities you’ve been so curious about, habits, quirks…

In this class I will show you how to calculate your Core numbers!  Your Core numbers, consist of the life path, expression, soul urge, and birthday numbers. Your Life Path number an important 40% of your Core – it represents the traits you were born with and continue to use throughout your lifetime.

There will be a discussion about what each of those numbers mean and how they relate to each other.  This is such an informative and fun event that you will want to continue to explore YOUR numbers – get a 3 ring binder, save your results – this class is just one of several in the study of numerology and we will build on these core numbers!

Both group and private lessons are available - if you would like to become a numerologist - see our website at www.intuitivebodyandsoul.com for more information.  Or call me: Joanie[masked]

If you have friends/family that may also benefit or be interested, please let them know.

To register for this class you must go onto the Billerica Rec. Site: http://recreation.town.billerica.ma.us/wbwsc/webtrac.wsc/wbsplash.html?wbp=1 

There you can choose your payment method.

Is there someone you know who you think would be interested or benefit from this event - let them know!

We look forward to seeing you!


Love & Light,

Joanie

Debbie

VISA/MC/DISCOVER are accepted for all workshops & gift certificates

 TIBS gift certificates are available now in any amount.  Visit our Website for more information:  www.intuitivebodyandsoul.com

We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.

results.description:
When did our diets begin to become so complicated to navigate? And what can we do to stay healthy without making food research another full-time job in our lives?
Following the success of the documentary, Fed Up, (produced by Laurie David and Katie Couric) Boston Health 2.0 will take an in-depth look at the food system as a whole throughout the United States (and globally). In the discussion, we’ll take a look at technology; did technology cause this shift – and can we use technology to fix it? We’ll speak with nutritionists at the nation’s top healthcare organizations, creators of nutrition and health apps, and researchers in the space, to get to the bottom of our healthcare today and where it intersects with IT.

Our panel will feature:
- Stacy Kennedy, MPH, RD, CSO, LDN - Senior Clinical Nutritionist at Dana Farber Cancer Institute
- Adela Hruby, PhD, MPH - Fellow, Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Educatin, Tufts University
- Alaina Adamas, PhD - CEO, Healthy Mation
- Laurent Adamowicz, MBA - Founder and President of EChO - Eradicate Childhood Obesity Foundation
- Christene Gerardi, EdM - Integrative Medicine Consultant

Fed Up can be seen on Netflix, and most other on-demand cable programs. To learn more about the documentary, visit the website here: http://fedupmovie.com/#/page/home

Join the conversation on Twitter using hashtags #BH20FedUp, #BostonHealth20 and #FedUpMovie For more information regarding the event, the speakers, or Boston Health 2.0, visit: www.bostonhealth20.com
results.name: The Intersection of Health and IT - Presented by Boston Health 2.0

results.description:
Spend some time on your project by bringing it along to our weekly project night, an evening designed around you and what you're working on.

This weekly event is about finding time to tinker, being creative, and meeting other members of the community.  You'll get the chance to see what others are working on, share your projects, and to get inspiration and feedback from fellow tinkerers.

On any given Tuesday night you have people working on electronics, knitting, writing code, wood-working, or just their plans for world domination. Beer is also consumed.

We’ll provide: space to work, basic tools, power, a room full of like minded people.

You’ll provide: your project, ideas and beer (optional). A laptop would probably be useful too.

Sometimes we work on group projects together, which are usually set up as separate meetup events. Keep an eye on our events page to see what we’re working on next.

results.description:
Eco-Film Series: The Salt of the Earth
When: May 31, 2016, 6:30PM
Where: Lowell National Historical Park Visitor Center, 246 Market St., Lowell, MA

TRAILER: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OivMlWXtWpY


The Salt of the Earth is a stunning visual journey through Sebastio Segaldo’s lens as it follows his new project: capturing the beauty of our planet. Seglado has been photographing people around the globe for forty years to draw attention to social injustices and natural resources. This film is a 2015 Academy Award nominee (110 min).
Stunning Photography!

GETTING TO THE VISITOR CENTER;:
From Interstate Route 495 take Exit 35C on to the Lowell Connector

From Route 3 take Exit 30A if traveling southbound, Exit 30B if traveling northbound.


• Take the Lowell Connector to Exit 5B Thorndike Street.
• Continue right on to Thorndike Street, which becomes Dutton Street.
• At the third traffic light continue straight under the overpass.
• At the next light turn right into the Visitor Center Parking Lot. Free parking is available here during Park operating hours in the gated section of the lot with ticket validation at the Visitor Center.
• From the lot, follow the set of steps located behind the flag pole and continue walking through the courtyard. The Visitor Center will be on your left.
results.name: FREE FILM: The Salt of the Earth

results.description:
I had to cover a lot... so please read all the text below.

Here's a video to get you started. Don't let the length intimidate you. Just focus on the first few minutes but do as much as you like.

https://youtu.be/aV8dS2m9Adc

I'm really excited about this event! We have permission to do a series of Beginner Salsa Lessons. (Swing lessons to follow if this is a success). Please help me make these a success by giving it a shot. You'll have a blast--trust me!

Our instructors have years of dancing experience, plenty of personality and of course, I'll be providing the sound system with some great music. I've taken group lessons before where the music was too fast, esp in the open dance time. So we're going to gear this to 2 left-footed dancers like me. :)


The Hanson Rec Commission members are very excited about this and want us to succeed. So please thank them when you see them at the event.


Our plan is to have weekly dance lessons for 2 hours. These will be geared for beginners so don't be afraid. To You Salsa veterans - please come because we'll need your help too... and you can show off during the open dance hour.


Once per month we'll be having a 4 hour dance with libations. We will announce these ahead of time....


Gender equity? of course ladies bring a man with you but for the first few lessons gender equity won't be a huge issue. Nevertheless, put the pressure on the men you know, in the group and out, to make it to this. It's gonna be a blast!

Please post questions below.

DIRECTIONS - Please use your GPS. For those of you who have never been, Hanson is only 30 min from Plymouth and Braintree. And only 15 min from Hanover or Brockton. So it's nice and centrally located. Camp Kiwanee is right on rt 58 with plenty of parking.

The cost is $10 per person - a very reasonable price. FYI - I don't make a dime on this. Camp Kiwanee gets a percentage of the door and the remainder goes to the instructors and those working the door.


Here's a few pictures of Needles Lodge at Camp Kiwanee. It's a gem right here in our little one-horse town of Hanson.

That's only about 2/3rds of the room. They were rehearsing a play in the other third. I'll get better pictures up there soon. But you get the idea.


the entrance... love this place... Old world charm...

results.description:
Contact me [Jose (click the link, then click "Message")] for the address.

General board gaming. We have a good library of widely played board games, and people normally bring many more of them. We regularly run three to five tables of board games - this provides enough variety.  It is normal for people to get two or three games a session.  The game night format was inspired by Unity Games and the event is very casual and structureless.  If you have gone to one of the meetup's quarterly events you will know.

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played?
A.  Any type of board game.  Browse through the most popular games at http://boardgamegeek.com/ and that should give you an idea.

Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm?
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  Should I bring something?  
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served. Feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/sodas in the pizza cup. 

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it?
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q.  Where do I park?
A.  The driveway is the obvious spot, but eventually it will fill up on most of these game nights.  Some people do park on the street.  The soccer field parking across the street is a safe option and is the suggestion the town police gave me when I asked about overflow parking.
results.how_to_find_us: The house is just across from a soccer field.  If the driveway starts to fill up, the soccer field parking lot is a good option.

results.description:
Cultivating Healthy Relationships                                                                                                     a meditation class series 

TUESDAYS | May 10th - June 14th


7:00 - 8:30pm

Relationships are a work in progress, so just imagine if all your relationships were free from conflict and deeply satisfying. Finding the right mental attitude is the key to making this happen. Without a fundamental shift in our views, we will continue to be stuck in our well-worn relationship patterns.

In this drop-in class series, we will learn how to distinguish between what love is – and what it isn’t. We will see how letting go of the mind of attachment can transform our bad relationships into good ones. And how it can make our good relationships even better! 

Each class is beginner friendly- feel free to drop-in to any class in the series or try to attend each one! No need to pre-register. 

with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher, Kyle Davis


Cost | $10 per class / $5 students & seniors.  Members FREE! 

Location | 179 Green Street – Boston, Jamaica Plain, MA 02130  

meditationINboston.org

For more info please call[masked] or email [masked]

results.description:
Back by request: Chuck Carter of Eagre Games will showcase his new work on "ZED."

Many people have requested that Chuck Carter from Eagre Games come back as our featured guest in May, 2016 to further showcase his work on ZED, and meet people who couldn't make it in March. Chuck will be showcasing the demo of ZED and speaking about his industry experience working on Myst at Cyan, creating the cinematic experiences of Command & Conquer and Red Alert at Westwood Studios, and what it's like to leave the AAA environment and found his own Central Maine studio.*

We would also like to discuss plans for the coming summer months, including a Virtual Reality Demo Night. Stay tuned!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KYf845mskOA

*Disclosure statement: 4+ people from this group have worked, are working, or have been offered work with Eagre Games. No conflict of interest is intended by this event

results.description:
This is a slightly longer book than we usually read, but luckily we have almost 5 weeks before the next Meetup. See you then!

Goodreads description:


From the award-winning author of Half of a Yellow Sun, a dazzling new novel: a story of love and race centered around a young man and woman from Nigeria who face difficult choices and challenges in the countries they come to call home.

As teenagers in a Lagos secondary school, Ifemelu and Obinze fall in love. Their Nigeria is under military dictatorship, and people are leaving the country if they can. Ifemelu—beautiful, self-assured—departs for America to study. She suffers defeats and triumphs, finds and loses relationships and friendships, all the while feeling the weight of something she never thought of back home: race. Obinze—the quiet, thoughtful son of a professor—had hoped to join her, but post-9/11 America will not let him in, and he plunges into a dangerous, undocumented life in London.

Years later, Obinze is a wealthy man in a newly democratic Nigeria, while Ifemelu has achieved success as a writer of an eye-opening blog about race in America. But when Ifemelu returns to Nigeria, and she and Obinze reignite their shared passion—for their homeland and for each other—they will face the toughest decisions of their lives.

Fearless, gripping, at once darkly funny and tender, spanning three continents and numerous lives, Americanah is a richly told story set in today’s globalized world: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie’s most powerful and astonishing novel yet.

https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15796700-americanah
results.name: Americanah -  Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

results.description:
Our weekly work session will be at the Cambridge Innovation Center in Kendall Square, on the FOURTH FLOOR, in the CAFE. These Hack Nights are our time to meet in person to work on and discuss civic tech projects. Come by to say hi and hack with us!

Transportation
The Red Line stop for CIC is Kendall. For those who drive, there is a pay parking lot underneath the building, and limited meter parking in the area. Additionally, the MIT Hayward St lot is free after 5pm. Please make sure to check in with security when you arrive.

Schedule
7:00pm - Opening remarks, project updates, announcements
7:20pm - New member orientation
8:00pm - Hacking!

During the event, join our Hackpad for announcement links and collaborative note taking.

To ensure that Code for Boston is a welcoming space for all, staff and participants are held to our Code of Conduct.

results.description:
Again, a big thank you to meetup member Derek L., who took the initiative to speak with the good folks at the Woburn Public Library and find out if we might be able to play there during weeknights.


We had a full group at the first WPL meetup, so I'm expanding the attendance limit to 12. Just keep in mind that there are no reserved tables at WPL (first come, first served), and that we may have to sit at different tables spaced around the main reading room, depending on what is available. Also be mindful that it is a library, and while they don't seem to demand strict silence, we should be courteous of our fellow patrons (I think we did a good job the first time around!).

Bring your set and board if you have one. I'll try to show up early and put out my board so you can easily find me.

Hope to see you there,
James
results.name: Chess at Woburn Public Library

Please RSVP for this event so we can be sure to grab enough tables!

Newcomers to American style Mah Jongg are welcome, provided that you have already learned the basics, as described on our About page! Thanks!

Note that MJ is usually played with 4 people, although it can be played with 2 or 3 as well, with some adjustment to the rules. If the number of RSVPs is not a multiple of 4, then we can decide whether to have multiple tables or have some sit out of some games and observe OR play a rack with another person. (This is a great way to learn!)

Thanks!

results.description:
This User's Guide orientation is intended to help active members who have attended at least three PGN events and are looking to utilize PGN more powerfully for their lives; it is also quite useful for members who might want to investigate being a leader and/or organizing events on PGN.

Topics

- (Back story: The genesis of PGN)
- Developing the qualities necessary for personal growth
- How PGN benefits active members
- How you can participate more fully
- Advanced user navigation
- Becoming an active member

About the Personal Growth Network

A MetaOrganizer 
The Personal Growth Network is a first-of-its-kind personal growth meta-organizer, bringing together diverse personal growth and positive psychology tools and techniques that are intended to help generally healthy people create greater joy and more success in all parts of their life. 

Via PGN, members can sample numerous approaches; they can select some approaches for more in-depth study; they can practice the approach sufficiently to impact their life in their desired direction; they can share their journey with other members, supporting one another; and, when they are complete with that phase of their growth, they can utilize PGN to find and explore a different approach or to refocus on a different part of their life. 

A Community 
PGN is also a community of like-hearted people who share an important, but not widely distributed, combination of values and characteristics (e.g., curiosity, willingness to learn, willingness to change habits, humility). These values not only help members to consciously and proactively craft a life well-lived, they are a way of experiencing the world, a way that is not widely shared in the general population. 

Engaging with other members of this community can be fascinating, supportive, and affirming for people who otherwise might believe that they are "odd" for having this important, extraordinary, and admirable combination of core values and characteristics. 

(To see if you share these characteristics, take our ten-question questionnaire.) 

A Toolbox 
PGN is a toolbox with which members can create events that support themselves and other members in the community. Members can create workshops, practice groups, and social events. Organizers might be trained, or they may have deep passion, or they may just want to share their journey, their gifts, their joys, their successes, their vision, or their interests. 

For these "leaders" in our community, PGN provides software, training, and support, and respectful access to the core people in the personal growth community who may be interested in joining them in their gifts.

A Marketplace
And finally, PGN is a marketplace, where leaders uncover numerous ways to serve more people more profoundly and more effectively.  Providers can offer their service broadly, discover and try out new techniques, tools and approaches, find out what works best for them, and iterate towards excellence.  Members can sample different providers, comparing sometimes side by side, and decide what makes the most sense to them for their next step in their life.

About the Orientation Series

Given the enormous ambition and power of the Personal Growth Network, and its rapid growth, it is easy to feel a little overwhelmed at first, so we offer some "How-To" guides to maximize your utilization of the Personal Growth Network for whatever your goals may be.  


Our Orientations include:

For Participants 
- Newbie Introduction: Wed Jun 15
. . . . . . . . . (For new, infrequent, or curious members) 
- User's Guide: Tues May 31, or Thu Jul 28
. . . . . . . . . (For active members of PGN) 
- Power User's Guide: Thu Jun 30, or Wed Sep 7
. . . . . . . . . (Heavy users customize PGN to their needs.)
. . . . . . . . . (Reducing emails and focus on your edge) 

For Leaders 
- Intro to PGN Leadership: Mon Aug 1
. . . . . . . . . (For members considering offering events) 
- Create an Event on PGN: Thu Sept 1
. . . . . . . . . (For members ready to offer an event) 
- Build Your Brand:  Thu Sept 29
. . . . . . . . . (For leaders who want to build a recognized 
. . . . . . . . . (and desired brand in the community.) 

(Note: Leaders should all be Advanced Users of PGN.)

Office Hours
- Community Office Hours: Sun May 22
. . . . . . . . . (Bring any question, concern, or comment 
. . . . . . . . . (and we'll work it out together.)

Click here for an updated list of all upcoming orientations

About This Particular Orientation:

There is no prerequisite to take this orientation, although it may be very useful to have taken the Newbie orientation.

 It is conceived for those members who are, or would like to be, active members on PGN.  Some of the concepts introduced here are expected to be understood in the leadership orientations.

The natural follow-up to this orientation is the Power User orientation.

I will also try to address any specific questions that you post below.

About The Webinar Technology:

This Orientation is offered as a "Zoom Webinar".  It allows us to share screens and to see and hear one another. 

You will need a computer, and you will need to be in a location where you can listen and watch without distractions.  (There will be opportunities for open discussion as well, so you may want to look presentable. ) 

Zoom runs on most platforms.  If you have not run it before, please click on the link a half-hour before to ensure that it is working on your system.

The link will be sent to you the day before the event.

Testimonials from Past Participants

Excellent and very helpful to me! Looking forward to participating in many more PGN events :) 
- Karen322 

Very informative. Organized well. Great quality software platform. Precisely as "advertised". 
- Sarah Rose

FANTASTIC! One of the best meetups I have ever been to (and I've been to 300+ and hosted a solid 1/2 of those)! Great presentation. Nice overview of the meetup group site - awesome tools for using meetup in general, too. Get in on one of these events!!! (Wondering if this should be a requirement w/in 6 months of joining or something?) Looking forward to meeting many fantastic people and growing together!!! 
- Angela

Great! Very well organized. Very thoroughly and helpfully informative. 
- Katrina

I really enjoyed your orientation.  I didn't expect to learn anything new as I've been attending PGN events for close to a year, but I never knew about the "Pages" on the site. 
- Susan James

I got a much clearer picture of how Dennis sees PGN: its purpose as a redesign of the personal growth industry -- creating a fresh, new space and community for personal growth. Neat!
- David Jenkins

results.description:
We're inviting all single Boston  professionals ages 25-45 to join us a for a casual after-work networking social complete with introductions and ice breakers.

This gathering is for single professionals who have either graduated from an Ivy League Institution or who has completed or are currently pursuing an advanced or specialty degree i.e. Masters, MBA, PhD, Paralegal, JD, or other specialized certificate program.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 - PREPAY ONLY

https://advanceddegreeboston.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

This event is a combination of a Match Live event and Speed Dating.  Join other singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night write down the names and the numbers of the people that you met and would like to see again.  You will then hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

ALL GUESTS ARE WELCOME TO EXCHANGE BUSINESS CARDS AND CONTACT INFO!

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code?  Be comfortable but keep it neat.

What is included?  $20 includes admission to the event,drink specials, and platters of appetizers served from 7-7:30pm or until gone.
results.name: Ivy League/Advanced Degree Singles  Social - Ages 25-45
